recipes.title: Challah
recipes.description: Traditional Jewish braided bread, rich with egg yolks and slightly sweet. Perfect for Shabbat or holidays.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and 1 tsp sugar in warm water. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in remaining sugar, oil, egg yolks, and salt.
Gradually add flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Divide each half into 3 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a rope about 12 inches long.
Braid 3 ropes together, pinching ends to seal. Place on greased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough.
Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush loaves with beaten egg. Sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds if desired.
Bake 30-35 minutes until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Cool on wire rack.

notes: Using mostly egg yolks gives this challah an especially rich, golden color.
For a shinier crust, brush with egg wash twice - once before rising and once just before baking.

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Bread
recipes.description: Hearty homemade whole wheat bread with honey and nonfat dry milk.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and honey. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in dry milk, salt, and oil.
Add whole wheat flour and stir until combined.
Gradually add bread flour until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 1/2 hours.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Shape each half into a loaf and place in greased 9x5-inch loaf pans.
Cover and let rise until dough reaches top of pans, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake 35-40 minutes until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Remove from pans and cool on wire rack.

notes: Nonfat dry milk adds protein and helps create a softer crumb.
For a softer crust, brush tops with melted butter immediately after baking.

recipes.title: French Bread
recipes.description: Classic crusty French bread with a chewy interior.

ingredients.prep_note: beaten with 1 tbsp water, for wash

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand until foamy, about 5-10 minutes.
Stir in salt.
Gradually add flour, mixing until a soft dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Roll each half into a 15x10-inch rectangle. Starting from long side, roll up tightly, pinching seams to seal.
Place seam-side down on baking sheet dusted with cornmeal. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place a shallow pan of hot water on lowest oven rack to create steam.
Using a sharp knife, make 3-4 diagonal slashes across top of each loaf. Brush with egg white wash.
Bake 25-30 minutes until deep golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped. Cool on wire rack.

notes: The pan of water creates steam for a crispy crust.
Original recipe had salt listed twice - confirmed correct amount is 1 tablespoon total.

flags.issue: Original had duplicate salt listing - confirmed 1 tbsp total is correct per standard French bread ratios

recipes.title: Pirogs
recipes.description: Savory bacon and onion filled yeast rolls, a family favorite.

instructions.text: Sprinkle yeast on warm water.
Add sugar, salt, and milk. Let stand a few minutes and stir.
Mix in half the flour.
Add egg and oil, then the rest of the flour.
Knead well and place in a greased bowl. Let rise until double.
Make into rolls and double again.
Brown bacon and onion for the filling.
After dough rises twice, fill each roll with bacon mixture and knead together.
Brush top with egg wash.
Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 400 degrees.

notes: Also known as pirozhki in Russian cuisine.
Can be made with various fillings - this version uses bacon and onion.

recipes.title: Calamondin Nut Bread
recipes.description: A moist quick bread with citrus flavor from dried calamondins, raisins and nuts.

instructions.text: Wash and dry calamondins; remove seeds and grind. This makes about 3/4 cup. Add sugar and set aside.
Sift together flour, salt, soda, cloves and cinnamon.
Cream together shortening, brown sugar and eggs; add calamondin mixture, then dry ingredients.
Add raisins and nuts. Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350 degrees 30-35 minutes or until bread tests done. Keeps well-frozen.

notes: Esther Vonhof usually doubles the recipe.
Freezes well for later use.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Bread
recipes.description: A simple quick bread with peanut butter flavor, perfect for toast or sandwiches.

instructions.text: Sift dry ingredients together.
Blend in butter and peanut butter until it resembles coarse meal.
Beat eggs and milk together. Combine mixture.
Spoon into a 9 x 5 x 3 loaf pan.
Bake at 350-degrees for one hour.
Cool for 10 minutes.

notes: Great toasted with jam.
Use creamy peanut butter for best texture.

recipes.title: Kashi Spice Rolls
recipes.description: Tender spiced rolls made with Kashi for added nutrition and texture.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water with honey. Let stand 5 minutes.
Add butter, spices, salt, Kashi, and 1 cup flour. Beat well.
Stir in remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead 5-8 minutes until smooth.
Let rise in warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch down and shape into 12 rolls.
Place in greased muffin tin or on baking sheet.
Let rise 20 minutes.
Bake at 375°F for 18-20 minutes until golden.

notes: Brush with melted butter after baking for softer crust

recipes.title: Date and Nut Bread
recipes.description: A classic quick bread studded with dates and nuts.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, add baking soda and boiling water to dates. Let cool.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 50 minutes or until tests done.

recipes.title: "Best Ever" Cranberry Muffins
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping with candy cane border
recipes.description: Tender muffins with cranberries, walnuts, and orange zest.

instructions.text: Soak cranberries in boiling water 5 minutes. Drain.
In a large mixing bowl, cream sugar and margarine until fluffy.
Add sour cream and mix well.
Combine dry ingredients; stir mixture until moistened.
Drain cranberries and fold into batter.
Add nuts & orange peel and mix completely.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 18-20 mins until tested done.
Cool 10 mins before removing.

notes: For Texas Style (6 large muffins), bake 30-35 minutes

recipes.title: Hot Cross Buns
recipes.description: Traditional Easter sweet rolls with currants and a lemon glaze cross.

instructions.text: In mixer bowl, combine warm milk and yeast; stir to dissolve.
Beat in butter, sugar and egg.
Sift flour with salt and mace; add to mixture in bowl and mix on medium speed of mixer with dough hook or knead by hand on lightly floured surface until dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.
Work in currants.
Cover and proof dough in warm place until doubled in bulk.
Lightly grease a 9- by 13-inch baking pan.
Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and divide in quarters. Shape each quarter into a 6-inch log; cut each log into 6 (1-inch) pieces.
Roll each piece into a round dough ball with palm of hand and arrange in prepared baking pan in rows of four across and six down.
Cover and let rise until doubled.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C); place buns on middle shelf of oven and immediately reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C); bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and done.
To make glaze for crosses: Stir powdered sugar with lemon juice and rind until smooth.
With tip of teaspoon, drizzle a line of glaze across each row of buns and another down to form a cross on each bun.

notes: Traditional Easter bread
Can use mace or cinnamon for spice

recipes.title: Orange-Oatmeal Scones
recipes.description: Hearty whole wheat scones with oats, orange, and golden raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 9-inch cake or pie pan with the shortening, set aside.
In mixing bowl, with finger tips mix whole wheat flour with oats, sugar, baking powder and salt, pulverizing any lumps of brown sugar.
Rub butter into flour-oatmeal mixture until incorporated.
In glass measuring cup, whisk orange rind and juice with yogurt, beat in egg, then stir into flour-oat mixture to make soft dough.
Mix in raisins.
Pat dough into prepared pan, cut through with paring knife to make 12 triangles.
Bake on middle shelf of oven 15 to 20 minutes, or until brown and crusty.
Cool 5 to 10 minutes in pan on rack, then cut into triangles as marked and serve, warm or at room temperature, with orange marmalade if desired.
Wrap leftovers tightly in plastic film for use in two days; or wrap in foil and freeze.

notes: Good with orange marmalade
Can be frozen for later use
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 142.jpeg

flags.issue: Left edge partially cut off - quantities inferred from context

recipes.title: Raisin Brown Bread
recipes.description: Old-fashioned steamed-style brown bread baked in soup cans with raisins, cornmeal, and wheat germ.

instructions.text: Combine raisins and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer a few minutes; set off heat.
Meanwhile, in large mixer bowl, beat together the sugar and butter.
Beat in the egg and vanilla.
Add raisin liquid. Stir in flour, cornmeal, wheat germ, soda and salt.
Fold in raisins.
Clean 5 (10 ounce) soup cans; grease and flour.
Fill cans about halfway, only slightly more than half.
Place cans on a cookie sheet, spaced well apart.
Bake at 300°F (150°C), a slow oven, for 1 hour or until the loaves test done with a cake tester or long straw.
Let cans cool a few minutes before loosening the breads with a thin spatula.
Invert cans and tap lightly to remove breads.

notes: Unique baking method using soup cans
Low and slow baking produces moist, dense bread

recipes.title: Potato Starter
recipes.description: Sourdough starter made with instant potato flakes. Ferments for 2-5 days before use.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water in medium mixing bowl.
Stir in 1 cup warm water, sugar and potato flakes.
Let mixture sit out all day, then refrigerate for 2-5 days.
Remove from refrigerator and feed again with 1 cup water, 2/3 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons instant potato flakes.
Stir well and keep at room temperature 10-12 hours.
Now you are ready to use 1 cup of the starter to make bread.
Return the rest to the refrigerator and feed again with ingredients above and keep at room temperature another day before making your next batch.

notes: Marina's note: 'You do NOT have to keep baking bread every two weeks for the rest of your life. You can take the starter out, feed it and keep only what you normally would back in the fridge, throwing the rest away. You do feel guilty though.'

recipes.title: Sourdough Potato Bread
recipes.description: Soft, tender bread made with potato starter. Makes excellent loaves or rolls.

instructions.text: In mixing bowl, combine starter, water, oil, salt and sugar.
With dough hook or wooden spoon gradually beat in enough flour to make a soft but workable dough.
Knead with dough hook or by hand for about 8 minutes on a floured board until satiny.
Turn dough into a greased bowl, cover and let rise until doubled.
Punch dough down; shape into loaves and place in lightly greased 8- to 9-inch loaf pans. Or form into rolls and arrange on lightly greased baking sheets.
Cover and let rise again until doubled.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) 18 to 20 minutes for 2-inch rolls, or 30 to 40 minutes for loaves.
Note: If desired, brush loaves or rolls with a beaten egg before placing in oven. Sprinkle top with poppy seeds, oatmeal or sesame seeds.

recipes.pan_size: 8- to 9-inch loaf pans or baking sheets
notes: Uses Potato Starter recipe
For: Barbara Buhrer of Bayonet Point, From: Dorothy Snidow of St. Petersburg

recipes.title: Almost Sugar-Free Apple-Walnut Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Healthy whole grain muffins sweetened with honey and fruit. Includes a homemade nutritious quick bread mix.

ingredients.prep_note: found in specialty food stores, for mix

instructions.text: For Nutritious Quick Bread Mix: Combine whole wheat flour, soy flour, salt, dry milk and baking powder. Store in airtight container.
For muffins: Combine all ingredients and mix until well-moistened. Do not over-mix or muffins will be tough.
Fill greased muffin tins two-thirds full.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) 15 to 20 minutes. Do not overbake.
For a lighter texture, fold in 1 stiffly beaten egg white.

notes: Variation: Use 2/3 cup grated carrots and 1/3 cup drained crushed pineapple instead of chopped apples
The quick bread mix makes multiple batches

recipes.title: Easter Babka
recipes.description: Traditional Eastern European yeast bread with golden raisins and sliced almonds, baked in a bundt pan.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar in large bowl. Beat 4 egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored. Stir into creamed mixture.
Soften yeast in 1/4 cup water. Use very warm water (115°F) for dry yeast; use lukewarm (80-90°F) for compressed.
Add to mixture with the lemon rind. Beat in salt and cinnamon.
Add milk and flour to make a soft dough.
Stir in raisins. Knead in bowl until dough no longer sticks to the hands.
Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk (about 2 hours).
Butter a 3-quart bundt pan and shape dough to fit it. Put dough in pan, cover and let rise again until doubled (about 1 1/2 hours).
Beat remaining egg yolk slightly with 2 tablespoons of water. Brush on raised dough and sprinkle with almonds.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes or until it tests done.
Cool on wire rack.

notes: Traditional Easter bread in Eastern European communities
Can use compressed or dry yeast

recipes.title: Chili Cheese Herb Biscuits
recipes.description: Quick drop biscuits with cheese, green chilies, and an herb butter topping.

ingredients.item: Colby, Monterey Jack or Cheddar cheese

instructions.text: In medium bowl, combine biscuit & baking mix, cheese, milk and chilies with fork until moistened.
Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet coated with nonstick spray.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10 to 13 minutes or until light brown.
Combine butter, parsley and garlic powder; brush on biscuits.
Serve warm.

notes: Similar to Red Lobster Cheddar Bay Biscuits with a Southwestern twist
The green chilies add mild heat

recipes.title: Mexicana Cornbread
recipes.description: Southwestern-style cornbread with cheese, green chiles, and optional avocado. Can be baked in flowerpots!

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together cornmeal, flour, baking powder, salt, cumin, and paprika.
In another bowl, lightly beat egg, stir in milk, oil, avocado (if used), bell pepper, chiles, and cheese.
Stir milk mixture into dry ingredients just to moisten evenly.
Pour into greased 8-inch square pan OR 6 greased 1-cup flowerpots (line holes with greased foil).
Bake at 400°F (200°C): 35 minutes for pan, 15-20 minutes for flowerpots, until pick comes out clean.
Cool 5 minutes, turn out onto rack. Wrap airtight.

notes: Can bake in flowerpots for gift-giving!
Freeze bread without avocado up to 1 month

recipes.title: Beer Bread
recipes.description: Incredibly simple 5-ingredient bread made with beer. Best with Pilsner Urquell.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease one loaf pan.
Place flour, sugar and salt in food processor. Turn on and off to mix dry ingredients.
Turn on food processor and while running, add beer.
Pour batter in loaf pan, top with melted butter.
Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.

notes: Pilsner Urquell recommended but any beer works
Food processor method is quick but can mix by hand

recipes.title: Cheddar Apple Bread
recipes.description: Sweet and savory quick bread with sharp cheddar cheese, fresh apples, and cinnamon.

ingredients.item: Kraft 100% Natural Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese

instructions.text: Combine dry ingredients.
Add combined eggs, milk and margarine; mix well.
Stir in remaining ingredients.
Spoon into well greased and floured 9 × 5-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C), 65 to 70 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Let stand 5 minutes; remove from pan.

notes: Let bread cool before slicing for cleaner cuts
Sharp cheddar provides best flavor contrast with apples

recipes.title: Raisin-Nut Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Hearty whole grain muffins with oats, bran, and your choice of nuts and dried fruit.

instructions.text: Lightly oil 12 muffin cups and dust with a little oat bran.
Put oats and oat bran in large mixing bowl. Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt in a sifter and sift into oats.
Add milk, oil, egg yolk and honey; mix well with a wooden spoon.
Stir in nuts and fruit or raisins.
In a small bowl, beat the 3 egg whites until stiff with an electric mixer at high speed.
Fold gently into batter.
Fill muffin cups with batter and bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
Cool on wire rack.

notes: Beating egg whites separately creates lighter muffins
Use any combination of nuts and dried fruit you prefer

recipes.title: Flea-Flicker Corn Bread
recipes.description: Savory cornbread loaded with Italian sausage, creamed corn, scallions, and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: In large skillet, over medium heat, cook sausage until done, stirring to break up meat; drain on paper towels.
In large bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda and sugar.
In small bowl, beat egg, milk, corn and margarine; stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
Stir in scallions and half sausage.
Spread batter into greased 9-by-9-by-2-inch baking pan; sprinkle with remaining sausage and cheese.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden.
Cut into squares and serve warm.

notes: Football-themed name - great for game day!
Use sweet or hot sausage per preference

recipes.title: Orange-Raisin-Pecan Bread
recipes.description: Moist quick bread bursting with orange flavor, raisins, and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine ingredients in order listed. Mix just until blended.
Pour into greased 9-by-5-inch pan.
Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until top is nicely browned and pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool in pan 10 minutes. Turn out of pan onto rack to cool completely.
Wrap in plastic wrap or foil.

notes: Let bread cool completely before slicing for best texture
Great toasted with butter

recipes.title: Sourdough Bread (Bread Machine)
recipes.description: Bread machine sourdough using a sourdough starter - basic setting with timer option.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan in the order listed above, beginning with the column on the left, followed by the column on the right.
Select Basic setting. Select crust setting if other than 'Medium'.
Press the 'Start/Stop' button to begin the breadmaking process. The display will begin counting down the minutes until the end of the cycle.
When the baking is complete, the display will read 0:00 and the unit will signal. You may choose to press the 'Start/Stop' button to cancel the 'Keep-Warm' cycle if desired.
Remove the bread and enjoy!

notes: All ingredients at room temperature (70-80°F/21-27°C)
Once the 'Start/Stop' button is pressed, the selected function(s) cannot be altered
To stop, press 'Start/Stop' and hold for 1-3 seconds until signal sounds

recipes.title: Everyday Sourdough
recipes.description: Artisan sourdough bread with overnight rise - a family's all-purpose go-to loaf with detailed baker's schedule.

instructions.text: BAKER'S SCHEDULE: Thursday-Saturday: Feed your starter until bubbly and active. Saturday Evening: Make the dough, and let rise overnight. Sunday Morning: Shape the dough, let rise again, score, and bake.

MAKE THE DOUGH: In the evening, whisk the starter and water together in a large bowl with a fork. Add the flour and salt. Combine until a stiff dough forms, then finish mixing by hand to fully incorporate the flour. Cover with a damp towel and let rest for 30 minutes. Replenish your starter with fresh flour and water, and store according to preference.

After the dough has rested, work the mass into a fairly smooth ball by grabbing a portion of the dough and folding it over, pressing your fingertips into the center. Repeat, working your way around the dough until it begins to tighten, about 15 seconds.

BULK RISE: Cover the bowl with a damp towel and let rise overnight at room temperature. This will take about 8 to 10 hours at 70°F (21°C). The dough is ready when it no longer looks dense and has doubled in size.

SHAPE: In the morning, coax the dough onto a lightly floured work surface. Shape it into a round: start at the top and fold the dough over toward the center. Turn the dough slightly and fold over the next section. Repeat until you have come full circle. Flip the dough over and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, line an 8-inch (20-cm) bowl with a towel and dust with flour. With floured hands, gently cup the dough and pull it toward you in a circular motion to tighten its shape. Using a bench scraper, place the dough into the bowl, seam side up.
SECOND RISE: Cover the bowl and let rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour. The dough is ready when it looks puffy and has risen slightly but has not yet doubled in size.
Preheat your oven to 450°F (230°C). Cut a sheet of parchment paper to fit the size of your baking pot, leaving enough excess around the sides to remove the bread.

SCORE: Place the parchment over the dough and invert the bowl to release. Sprinkle the dough with flour and gently rub the surface with your hands. Score the dough with the cross-cut pattern or any way you'd like. Use the parchment to transfer the dough to the baking pot.

BAKE: Bake the dough on the center rack for 20 minutes, covered. Remove the lid, and continue to bake for 30 minutes. Then, carefully remove the loaf from the pot and bake directly on the oven rack for the last 10 minutes to crisp the crust. When finished, transfer to a wire rack. Cool for 1 hour before slicing.

recipes.pan_size: Dutch oven or baking pot with lid, 8-inch bowl for proofing
notes: Handwritten notes on original: 'Preheat to 500° w/ dutch oven inside. Drop temp to 425° & bake w/lid for 25min. Drop temp to 380° remove lid, & bake for 30min.'
Sourdough is best consumed on the same day it is baked. To maximize freshness, cool completely and store at room temperature in a plastic bag for up to 1 day.

recipes.title: Salt-Rising Bread
recipes.description: A traditional Appalachian bread that uses a potato-cornmeal starter instead of yeast - distinctive tangy flavor and dense texture.

instructions.text: For the starter: Pare and dice potatoes. Add corn meal, sugar, salt and boiling water.
Wrap bowl in a heavy cloth. Cover and allow to stand overnight in a warm place.
Add milk, water, soda, salt and shortening to the starter.
Add sufficient flour to make a dough that is just stiff enough to knead, then knead until smooth and elastic.
Form into loaves.
Place loaves in well-oiled pans. Cover and let rise until it doubles in bulk.
Bake in oven at 400°F (200°C) about 45 minutes.

notes: Salt-rising bread uses a starter made from potatoes rather than yeast used in most types of raised breads
Must be kept warm during rising - a gas oven with pilot light works well

recipes.title: Poteca Loaf
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping - 'Sweet Dough With Ground Nuts and Sugar'
recipes.description: A traditional Eastern European sweet bread filled with a ground nut and brown sugar filling, rolled jelly-roll style.

ingredients.prep_note: warm for dry yeast, lukewarm for compressed
ground or finely grated, for filling

instructions.text: Add sugar, salt and one-fourth cup margarine to scalded milk; cool to lukewarm.
Measure water into large bowl (warm water for dry yeast, lukewarm for compressed). Sprinkle or crumble in yeast; stir until dissolved.
Stir in milk mixture, one egg and half the flour; beat until smooth. Stir in remaining flour to make soft dough.

Turn out on lightly floured board; knead until smooth and elastic. Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover; let rise in warm place, free from draft, until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.
Meanwhile, make filling by combining remaining one-fourth cup margarine with brown sugar, one egg, nuts and extract.

Punch down dough; turn out on lightly floured board; roll into 20x10-inch oblong. Spread evenly with filling. Roll up jelly-roll fashion, starting from long side. Pinch seam to roll to seal firmly. Cut into three equal pieces.
Place pieces side by side, with seam side down, in greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan.
Cover; let rise in warm place, free from draft, until dough rounds slightly above top of pan, about 1 hour.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25 minutes, or until done.
Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.

notes: This bread may be frozen and kept in reserve. To serve the frozen loaf, just thaw at room temperature for two hours or heat in 375-degree oven for 20 minutes.
Poteca Loaf teams with ice cream for unusual dessert

recipes.title: Carrot Corn Muffins
recipes.description: Savory corn muffins studded with shredded carrots for color and nutrition.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease 12-cup muffin tin.
In medium bowl combine carrots and cornmeal.
Heat milk to boiling and add to bowl; let mixture cool to room temperature.
Stir in eggs and oil. Add flour, baking powder and salt; stir just until combined.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden.

notes: Recipe clipping cut off at bottom - instructions partially reconstructed

flags: Bottom of clipping cut off - baking instructions estimated

recipes.title: Beer Bread
recipes.description: The simplest quick bread - just three ingredients for a crusty, flavorful loaf.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan.
Mix all ingredients together until just combined.
Pour into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour at 350°F until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.

notes: Self-rising flour is essential - do not substitute all-purpose
Any style of beer works - darker beers give more flavor

recipes.title: German Nut Kuchen
recipes.description: A traditional German coffee cake made with yeast dough - rich with butter and eggs.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in 1 tbsp sugar in warm milk.
Add 1/2 cup flour to make sponge - beat until smooth.
Cover and set aside in warm place for 3/4 hour.
Have sugar and butter creamed and add to sponge.
Add eggs, remaining flour and salt. Knead lightly to make soft dough.
Place in greased pan and let rise until doubled.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) until golden brown.

notes: Recipe continues on missing page - baking time estimated
Kuchen is German for 'cake'

flags: Partial recipe - baking instructions cut off

recipes.title: Easy-Does-It Yeast Breads (Basic Recipe)
recipes.description: A versatile basic white bread recipe with unlimited variety from one basic recipe - includes variations for French, Rye, Whole Wheat, and specialty breads.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury's Best unbleached or all-purpose flour
Red Star Instant Blend dry yeast

instructions.text: Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off.
Combine in large mixer bowl; blend.
Heat in saucepan over low heat until very warm (120-130°F).
Add eggs and warm liquid to flour mixture.
Blend at low speed until moistened; beat 3 minutes at medium speed.
With spoon, stir in additional 3-3 1/2 cups flour to form a sticky dough.
Dough in bowl on board. Kneading or working in additional flour until dough is smooth, pliable, and no longer sticky (about 5 minutes).
Place dough in greased bowl; cover. Let rise in warm place until light and doubled in size, about 45 minutes.
Punch down dough several times to remove all air bubbles; divide into 2 parts.
Form dough into desired shapes; place in greased pans according to shaping & baking directions.
Cover; let rise in warm place until light and doubled in size, about 30 minutes.
Bake bread at 375°F. All loaves - 35 to 45 minutes or until loaf sounds hollow when lightly tapped. All rolls - 10 to 20 minutes.

recipes.pan_size: Various - 9x5 or 8x4 inch loaf pans, cookie sheets
notes: VARIATIONS INCLUDED: French Bread, Rich Egg Bread, South-of-the-Border Loaf, Sweet Dough, Cinnamon Swirl, 100% Whole Wheat Bread, Specialty Dark Brown Variations, Hearty Whole Wheat Loaves, Light Pumpernickel Loaf, Delicatessen Rye Bread
SHAPING OPTIONS: Regular Loaf, Round Loaf, French & Oblong Loaf, Coil, Twist, Figure Eight, Doughnut shapes, Round Rolls, Vienna Rolls, Breadsticks
GLAZE OPTIONS: Soft Buttery Crust, Crisp Shiny Crust, Delicatessen Bread Crust, Cinnamon/Sugar Crust, Slightly Crisp Shiny Sweet Crust

recipes.title: Carrot Bread
recipes.description: A moist, spiced carrot bread loaded with raisins, nuts, and maraschino cherries - includes a rich vanilla pudding frosting.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease two loaf pans.
Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and sugar in a large bowl.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Beat eggs with oil. Add to dry ingredients along with carrots and cherries.
Mix until well combined. Pour into prepared pans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.
For frosting: Cook vanilla pudding with 1 cup milk. Let cool completely.
Cream butter and sugar together. Add cooled pudding and vanilla. Beat until fluffy.
Frost cooled bread.

notes: The vanilla pudding frosting makes this extra special
Very moist due to high oil content

recipes.title: Dilly Bread
recipes.description: A savory cottage cheese bread flavored with dill seed and onion - a classic casserole bread that doesn't require shaping.

instructions.text: Soften yeast in warm water.
Combine in bowl: cottage cheese, sugar, onion, butter, dill seed, salt, soda, egg and softened yeast.
Add flour to make a stiff dough.
Let rise to double in size.
Stir down and turn into a greased 8-inch casserole or round baking dish.
Let rise until light.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40-50 minutes until golden brown.

recipes.pan_size: 8-inch casserole dish or round baking dish, greased
notes: A casserole bread - no kneading or shaping required
Dill seed gives this bread its distinctive flavor

recipes.title: Pineapple Zucchini Bread
recipes.description: A moist, tropical twist on zucchini bread with crushed pineapple, cinnamon, and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease two loaf pans.
Beat eggs, sugar, and oil together.
Stir in drained pineapple, grated zucchini, and vanilla.
In separate bowl, combine flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients; mix until combined.
Fold in nuts.
Pour into prepared pans and bake at 350°F for about 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Drain pineapple well to prevent soggy bread

recipes.title: Herbed Cheese Biscuits
recipes.description: Tender, flaky biscuits with dill and sharp cheese - includes a cinnamon biscuit variation.

ingredients.item: sharp shredded Cheddar or Swiss cheese

instructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, dill and salt.
With a pastry blender, two knives or a fork, cut in Crisco All-Vegetable Shortening until mixture looks like coarse meal.
Stir in shredded cheese.
Add milk and stir just enough to hold dough together.
Place on a lightly floured surface and knead lightly; roll 3/4-inch thick.
Cut with floured biscuit cutter without turning the biscuit cutter (push straight down).
Place on a parchment-lined cookie sheet.
Bake at 425°F for 12 to 15 minutes, or until brown as desired.

notes: CINNAMON BISCUITS VARIATION: Follow directions for cheese biscuits, omitting cheese and dill, reduce the milk to 1/2 cup and sprinkle with a mixture of sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 425°F for 6 to 9 minutes, or until brown as desired.

recipes.title: Corn Bread
recipes.description: A lightly sweetened corn bread made with honey and butter - tender and golden.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Lightly grease an 8-inch-square baking pan.
Melt butter and honey together and set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, sift cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and milk together. Stir in cooled butter mixture.
Add liquid ingredients to dry ones and stir to combine.
Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake for 25 minutes or until bread is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Invert onto a cake rack to cool completely.

notes: Honey adds natural sweetness and moisture

recipes.title: Elba's Brown Bread
recipes.description: A hearty New England-style brown bread with bran, whole wheat flour, and molasses - can be steamed or baked.

ingredients.prep_note: or use 1/2 cup whole wheat flour

instructions.text: Mix all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Add molasses, sour milk, and raisins or nuts.
Beat well to combine.
FOR STEAMING: Fill greased molds 3/4 full and cover tightly. Steam for 3 hours.
FOR BAKING: Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 325-350°F (165-175°C) for 1 hour.

recipes.temperature: 325-350°F (165-175°C) for baking; steaming is an option
recipes.pan_size: Small loaf pans or coffee cans, greased
notes: Traditional Boston brown bread is steamed
Sour milk can be made by adding 1 tbsp vinegar to fresh milk

recipes.title: Thrifty Maid Old Fashioned Biscuits
recipes.description: Classic Southern-style biscuits - tender, flaky, and simple. Includes buttermilk variation.

instructions.text: Mix Thrifty Maid All-Purpose Flour, salt and baking powder.
Cut or rub in shortening.
Add milk to make soft dough, knead lightly.
Roll 1/4-inch thick, cut and bake in 450°F (230°C) oven until golden brown.

notes: BUTTERMILK BISCUITS VARIATION: Same recipe, but replace milk with buttermilk and use only 2 tsp baking powder. Add 1/4 tsp baking soda.

recipes.title: Mince Meat Ginger Bread
recipes.description: A moist, spiced gingerbread enriched with mincemeat for extra depth and holiday flavor.

instructions.text: Prepare mincemeat according to package directions with cold water. Let cool.
Melt oleo and beat in sugar and egg.
Combine flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to oleo mixture along with molasses and hot water.
Fold in prepared mincemeat.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.

notes: Perfect for the holiday season

recipes.title: Calamondin Bread
recipes.description: A Florida specialty - a spiced quick bread made with calamondins, the tiny sour citrus fruit popular in Southern gardens.

instructions.text: Prepare calamondins by removing seeds and processing or finely chopping (including rind for flavor).
Combine with white sugar and set aside.
Sift together flour, salt, baking soda, cloves, and cinnamon.
Cream shortening with brown sugar. Beat in eggs.
Add dry ingredients alternately with prepared calamondins.
Fold in raisins and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake for 30 minutes at 350°F (175°C) or until done.

notes: Calamondins are small sour citrus fruits common in Florida
Can substitute kumquats if calamondins unavailable

recipes.title: Apple Sauce Bread
recipes.description: A moist, spiced bread combining applesauce and grated zucchini with walnuts and raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat together sugar, eggs and oil.
Sift together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, baking powder, nutmeg and cloves.
Add dry ingredients to sugar mixture.
Stir in vanilla, raisins, walnuts, grated zucchini and applesauce.
Grease and flour 2 bread pans.
Divide batter between pans and bake at 350°F.

recipes.pan_size: Two 9x5-inch loaf pans, greased and floured
notes: Combines the moisture of zucchini bread with the flavor of applesauce bread

recipes.title: Quick Praline Rolls
recipes.description: Quick and easy caramel-nut yeast rolls with a praline topping. Dough can be refrigerated overnight.

ingredients.item: Red Star Special Active Dry Yeast

ingredients.prep_note: cut in until particles are fine

instructions.text: Soften yeast in warm water.
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into mixing bowl. Cut in 1/3 cup butter until particles are fine.
Stir in scalded milk (cooled to lukewarm), egg, and softened yeast; beat well.
Toss on well-floured surface to coat with flour. Roll out to 15x10 inches.
Cream 1/3 cup butter with brown sugar until fluffy.
Spread half of sugar mixture over dough. Sprinkle with half of the chopped walnuts. Roll up starting with 15-inch side.
Cut into 1-inch slices; place on greased cookie sheets. Flatten; spread with remaining sugar mixture. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts. Cover with Saran Wrap.
Let rise in warm place until light, about 45 minutes.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: Dough may be covered with Saran Wrap and stored in refrigerator several hours or overnight. Shape rolls. Let rise; bake as directed.
To freeze baked rolls, wrap in Saran Wrap, freeze.

recipes.title: Martyr's Bran Muffins
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card with apple border ('The Fruit of the Spirit is Joy')
recipes.description: A large-batch bran muffin batter that can be refrigerated for 6-8 weeks, ready to bake anytime.

instructions.text: Pour boiling water over All-Bran and Bran Buds cereals. Set aside to cool.
Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk.
Cream shortening and sugar. Add beaten eggs.
Add flour and salt to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk mixture.
Stir in soaked bran mixture. Mix all together.
Store in covered container in refrigerator for up to 6-8 weeks.
When ready to bake, fill greased muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes.

notes: Batter keeps in refrigerator for 6-8 weeks
Do not stir batter when removing portions to bake

recipes.title: BB Muffins
recipes.source_note: Handwritten on Shanty Creek Resort notepad
recipes.description: Basic bran or blueberry muffins - a simple, versatile muffin recipe.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease muffin tin.
Beat egg with milk and oil.
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir just until moistened.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden.

notes: Add 1 cup blueberries for blueberry muffins
Can add bran for bran muffins

recipes.title: Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.source_note: Handwritten on Shanty Creek Resort notepad
recipes.description: Hearty oatmeal muffins made with buttermilk for tender texture.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease muffin tin.
Beat egg with buttermilk, brown sugar, and shortening.
Mix oatmeal, flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake 20-25 minutes.

notes: Buttermilk makes these extra tender

recipes.title: Homemade Donuts
recipes.source_note: Handwritten on Shanty Creek Resort notepad
recipes.description: Classic cake donuts with cinnamon and nutmeg, fried to golden perfection.

instructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Beat eggs with milk and add to dry mixture. Mix to form soft dough.
Roll out on floured surface to 1/2 inch thick. Cut with donut cutter.
Heat oil to 375°F (190°C) in deep pot.
Fry donuts 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels. Glaze or sugar while warm.

notes: Oil should be 3-4 inches deep
Don't overcrowd the pot when frying

recipes.title: Min's Brown Bread
recipes.description: A hearty brown bread made with graham flour, molasses, and buttermilk, with optional raisins and nuts.

instructions.text: Blend molasses, brown sugar, egg, and salt.
Add soda to flour.
Alternate adding buttermilk with flour mixture.
Lightly fold in raisins and 1 cup chopped nuts if desired.
Pour into 2 loaf pans or 3 small loaf pans.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes for large pans.

recipes.pan_size: 2 loaf pans or 3 small loaf pans
notes: Graham flour gives this bread its distinctive nutty flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 999.jpeg

recipes.title: Brown Bread (Sour Milk Version)
recipes.description: A quick brown bread made with both brown and white flour, sour milk, and optional dried fruits and nuts.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients together: brown flour, white flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt.
Add brown sugar, egg, and sour milk.
Add raisins, dates, and nuts as desired.
Pour into 2 small loaf pans.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 35 minutes.

notes: Sour milk can be made by adding 1 tbsp vinegar to 1 cup milk
Variant of brown bread with different flour ratio
recipes.variant_notes: Different flour ratio (brown/white vs graham) and lower temperature

recipes.title: Monkey Bread
recipes.description: Classic pull-apart yeast bread with buttery diamond-shaped pieces baked in a tube pan.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Melt 1/2 cup butter, add salt, sugar, and evaporated milk. Stir until sugar dissolves.
Stir butter mixture into yeast mixture.
Beat in flour all at once until batter is smooth and elastic.
Knead until satiny smooth.
Cover and raise until double (about 1 hour).
Punch down, roll out to rectangle 18x12 inches.
Cut into diamond shapes about 3 inches.
Dip each piece in melted oleo (remaining 1/2 cup) to coat all sides.
Place overlapping in ungreased 12-cup tube pan.
Raise until double.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes.

notes: Pull apart to serve - no slicing needed

recipes.title: Black Bread
recipes.description: A dark rye bread with cocoa, molasses, and caraway seeds for rich, complex flavor.

instructions.text: In large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, yeast, cocoa, and caraway seeds.
Measure molasses in 2-cup measure, then pour into saucepan.
Use same cup, add 1 cup warm water to remaining molasses. Mix in butter, sugar, and salt.
Heat just until butter melts, stir to blend.
Add to flour mixture. With electric mixer, mix 1/2 minute at low speed, then turn to high and mix for 3 minutes.
Combine 1 cup rye flour and mix into dough. Then add more rye flour to make soft dough.
Turn onto floured board and knead until smooth.
Cover and let rest 20 minutes.
Punch dough and divide in half. Shape into 2 loaves.
Put in oiled pans. Let rise to double.
Bake until done.

notes: Cocoa gives the bread its dark color without chocolate flavor
Temperature inferred - original did not specify

flags: Baking temperature not specified in original - standard rye bread temp used

recipes.title: Eleanor's Zucchini Bread
recipes.description: A moist, cinnamon-spiced quick bread made with grated zucchini (or squash).

instructions.text: Mix together: eggs, oil, sugar, vanilla, and grated squash.
In another bowl, combine flour, salt, cinnamon, baking soda, and baking powder.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and mix well.
Pour into 2 greased loaf pans.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 60-75 minutes.

notes: 3 tbsp cinnamon is generous - adjust to taste
Can use zucchini or yellow squash

recipes.title: Zucchini Bread with Coconut
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card with coffee grinder illustration
recipes.description: Moist zucchini bread with coconut and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two loaf pans.
Beat eggs, add sugar and oil, mix well.
Add grated zucchini and mix.
In separate bowl, combine flour, coconut, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and nuts.
Add dry ingredients to wet mixture and stir until combined.
Divide batter between prepared pans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Contains coconut which distinguishes this from other zucchini bread recipes

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Nut Bread (Good)
recipes.description: Healthy whole wheat bread with applesauce, soy flour, raisins, and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan well.
Mix dry ingredients: whole wheat flour, soy flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
Add beaten eggs and milk with stirring.
Add applesauce and brown sugar, stir lightly.
Add raisins and nuts.
Let dough stand 20 minutes in well-oiled pan.
Bake at 350°F for one hour, or until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Marked 'GOOD' on original card
Contains soy flour for extra protein
Rest time before baking is important
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 881.jpeg

recipes.title: Cornmeal Quick Bread [INCOMPLETE]
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card, torn and faded
recipes.description: Quick bread made with wheat flour and cornmeal. Recipe card is damaged and incomplete.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients together.
[UNCLEAR - remaining instructions cut off or illegible]

notes: Card is torn and faded
Missing wet ingredients and complete instructions
Appears to be a quick bread or muffin recipe

recipes.title: Brown Bread
recipes.description: Quick brown bread with raisins, dates, and nuts using sour milk.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Mix dry ingredients together.
Beat egg with sour milk.
Combine wet and dry ingredients.
Fold in raisins, dates, and nuts.
Pour into 2 small greased loaf pans.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for about 35 minutes.

notes: Brown flour = whole wheat flour
Sour milk can be made by adding 1 tbsp vinegar to regular milk

recipes.title: Boston Brown Bread
recipes.description: Traditional steamed Boston brown bread baked in coffee cans with molasses and cornmeal.

ingredients.prep_note: with 1 tsp soda dissolved in it

instructions.text: Grease 2 coffee cans and their lids.
Mix egg, sugar, and molasses together.
Dissolve baking soda in sour milk.
Combine cornmeal, graham flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add lard/shortening.
Alternate adding sour milk mixture with flour mixture.
Fold in raisins, nuts, and currants.
Pour into prepared coffee cans; cover with lids.
Bake with covers on for 1½ hours.
Remove covers and bake 15 minutes more to brown tops.

notes: Traditional New England steamed bread
Coffee can method creates round slices perfect for sandwiches

recipes.title: Brown Bread
recipes.description: Brown bread made with graham flour and buttermilk.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Blend molasses, brown sugar, egg, and salt.
Add soda to flour.
Alternate adding buttermilk with flour mixture to the molasses mixture.
Lightly fold in raisins and 1 cup chopped nuts if desired.
Pour into greased loaf pans.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45 minutes for large pans.

recipes.pan_size: 2 loaf tins or 3 small loaf pans
notes: Graham flour gives a nutty, wholesome flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 999.jpeg

recipes.title: Johnny Cake
recipes.description: Traditional cornmeal quick bread, also known as johnnycake or journey cake.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 9-inch square pan.
Mix dry ingredients together (cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, soda).
Cut in lard until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Beat egg with sour milk.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir just until combined.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes until golden.

notes: Traditional New England/Southern quick bread
Sour milk = buttermilk or milk with 1 tbsp vinegar

recipes.title: Carrot Raisin Muffins
recipes.description: Wholesome muffins with carrots, pineapple, and raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease or line 12 muffin cups.
Mix dry ingredients (flours, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger) in a large bowl.
In another bowl, combine beaten eggs, crushed pineapple (with juice), grated carrot, raisins, corn syrup, and vanilla.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir just until combined.
Fold in nuts if using.
Fill muffin cups ⅔ full.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes or until golden and a toothpick comes out clean.

notes: The pineapple keeps these moist

recipes.title: Blueberry Muffins
recipes.description: Classic homemade blueberry muffins.

instructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together (dry ingredients).
In separate bowl, mix egg, oil, and milk.
Pour wet ingredients over dry ingredients.
Fold in blueberries.
Fill muffin cups about ⅔ full.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.

recipes.variant_notes: Files 660 and 1080 show same recipe with slight variation: 1/3 cup oil (vs 1/2 cup), 1 cup blueberries (vs 1.25 cups)

recipes.title: Raisin Scones
recipes.description: Classic British-style raisin scones with nutrition information.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Whisk milk and egg together.
Mix dry ingredients in another bowl.
Drop the butter into the flour and using your fingers, rub until the mixture is pebbly.
Pour in milk and egg mixture. Mix with a fork until dough is evenly moist.
Add raisins and stir.
Spoon a dozen mounds of dough onto baking sheet.
Bake for 20-22 minutes until golden.

recipes.title: [UNCLEAR - Possibly Biscuits]
recipes.source_note: Vintage handwritten recipe card with stove illustration - severely damaged and faded
recipes.description: Faded recipe card that appears to be for biscuits or pastry dough - too damaged to fully read.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients
[UNCLEAR] Shortening until it looks like corn meal
[UNCLEAR - rest of instructions not legible]

Appears to be classic biscuit or pie crust recipe based on visible ingredients and 'cut shortening until like corn meal' technique
Decorative vintage card with antique stove illustration

recipes.title: Banana Nut Bread
recipes.description: A classic moist banana bread with chopped nuts.

instructions.text: Cream together shortening and sugar; add eggs and beat well.
Sift together dry ingredients.
Add to creamed mixture alternately with banana, blending well after each addition.
Stir in nuts.
Pour into well greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 to 50 minutes, or until done.
Cool, wrap, and store overnight.

recipes.title: Cheese Bread
recipes.description: Homemade yeast bread with Swiss and Parmesan cheeses - makes 4 loaves.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of the flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Mix well.
Gradually add water and 2 tablespoons margarine. Mix until soft dough forms.
Combine Swiss and Parmesan cheeses. Reserve 1/4 cup.
Add remaining cheese mixture, egg, and 1 cup of the flour to dough. Mix well.
On floured surface, cover, and let rest in warm place 20 minutes.
On lightly floured surface, knead dough a few times. Divide into 4 equal pieces.
Cover and let rise 15 minutes. Roll out each piece in a rectangle and roll up from short side. Press end to seal. Fold end under loaf.
Place seam side down in 4 greased 6x3 inch loaf pans. Cover; let rise until double in volume, about 50 minutes.
Make a 1/4 inch deep slit lengthwise on top of each loaf. Sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon remaining cheese mixture.
Bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan immediately.
Brush with margarine.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Bread
recipes.description: A sweet quick bread with a cinnamon-sugar swirl.

instructions.text: Mix 1 cup sugar, flour, soda, salt, buttermilk, oil, and egg.
Pour half the batter in greased 5x9 inch bread pan.
Mix cinnamon and 1/2 cup sugar for topping.
Sprinkle half of the cinnamon-sugar mixture over batter.
Pour remaining batter on top.
Sprinkle with remaining cinnamon mixture.
Swirl with knife.
Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

flags.issue: Recipe continues on next page - full baking instructions not shown

recipes.title: Pecan Muffins
recipes.description: Quick and easy muffins with pecans, sour cream, and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Sift dry ingredients; add nuts and mix together milk, shortening, sour cream, and eggs.
Combine dry and liquid quickly with little stirring.
Pour into muffin pan. Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Six Week Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Make-ahead bran muffin batter that keeps in the refrigerator for up to 6 weeks.

instructions.text: Mix in order given.
Use paper liners in muffin tins. Bake at 400°F for 15 to 20 minutes.
Batter will keep in a covered container in refrigerator for up to 6 weeks.

notes: Batter keeps refrigerated for 6 weeks

recipes.title: Unbelievable Oat-Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Healthy, moist muffins with oat bran, banana, and pineapple - only 110 calories each!

ingredients.item: oat bran flour (oat bran may be used)

ingredients.prep_note: in own juice, fruit and juice used

instructions.text: Mix the dry ingredients together.
In a separate bowl, mix wet ingredients.
Combine wet and dry mixtures and mix gently.
Spray muffin pan with nonstick vegetable oil such as Pam and bake at 350°F for 20 to 25 minutes.
May be frozen after cooked.

notes: One muffin serving equals 110 calories, 3g fat, 0 cholesterol, 7.8g protein
Can be frozen

recipes.title: Baking Powder Biscuits
recipes.description: Classic baking powder biscuits with two variations - regular milk or buttermilk.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients; cut in shortening.
Stir in most of the milk. If dough is not pliable, add just enough to make a soft puff, easy to roll.
Knead on cloth-covered board 20 to 25 times (30 seconds).
Cut and place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until golden brown.

notes: Buttermilk variation: Use 2 cups flour, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp soda, 2/3 cup buttermilk, 2 tsp sugar, 2 tsp baking powder, 1/3 cup shortening

recipes.title: 90 Minute Rolls
recipes.description: Quick yeast rolls ready in just 90 minutes.

instructions.text: Combine 3/4 cup flour, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Heat water, milk, and margarine to 130°F. Add to dry ingredients.
Beat 2 minutes at medium speed. Add 1/4 cup flour; beat on high 2 minutes.
Stir in remaining flour. Knead 2 to 3 minutes until smooth.
Place in greased bowl and set in pan of very warm water for 1/2 hour.
Divide into 12 smooth balls. Place in greased round cake pan and let stand in pan of hot water 15 minutes.
Bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Quick Mix (Homemade Bisquick)
recipes.description: Make your own Bisquick-style baking mix to keep on hand.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Store in airtight container. Use within 10 to 12 weeks as you would Bisquick.

notes: Use within 10-12 weeks
Use as substitute for Bisquick

recipes.title: Strawberry Bread
recipes.description: A sweet quick bread made with frozen strawberries and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour two 9x5 inch loaf pans; set aside.
In medium bowl, stir thawed strawberries, eggs, and oil.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, and nuts.
Add strawberry mixture to dry ingredients and stir just until blended.
Pour into pans. Bake 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

recipes.title: Monkey Bread
recipes.description: Pull-apart cinnamon sugar bread made easy with canned biscuits.

instructions.text: Boil together oleo, brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon cinnamon.
In a plastic bowl with a lid, put sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon.
Using one can at a time, cut biscuits into quarters. Place in bowl and shake to coat.
Place in greased tube pan. Sprinkle raisins and nuts over the top.
Continue layering with each can of biscuits, but do not put raisins/nuts on top layer.
Put rest of sugar mixture on top layer. Pour oleo mixture over top of it all.
Bake at 350°F for 35 to 45 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes.
Let guests pull apart to serve themselves.

recipes.title: Zucchini Bread
recipes.description: Moist zucchini quick bread with cinnamon and optional nuts.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 325°F. Grease generously bottoms only of 2 loaf pans, 9x5x3 inches.
Blend all ingredients on low speed 1 minute. Beat on medium for 1 minute.
Pour into pans.
Bake until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 50 minutes to 1 hour.
Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool completely.
Store in refrigerator.

recipes.title: Sticky Buns
recipes.description: Easy overnight sticky buns made with frozen dinner rolls and butterscotch pudding.

instructions.text: Grease Bundt pan well; arrange frozen rolls in a double circle.
Sprinkle pudding and chopped nuts over rolls, then brown sugar.
Melt butter and pour over all.
[INFERRED] Cover and let rise overnight. Bake in the morning.

notes: Recipe continues on next page - overnight rising and baking instructions partially inferred

recipes.title: Cranberry Fruit Bread
recipes.description: A festive quick bread with cranberries, orange, and nuts.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, soda, and salt.
In a small bowl, combine well beaten egg, orange juice, orange rind, and oil.
Make a well in dry ingredients and add egg mixture all at once. Mix only to dampen.
Carefully fold in nuts and cranberries.
Spoon into greased loaf pan (9x5x3 inches). Spread corners and sides slightly higher than center.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, or until crust is brown and toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Remove from pan; cool and store overnight for easy slicing.

notes: Store overnight for easy slicing

recipes.title: Orange Walnut Bread
recipes.description: A citrus-flavored quick bread with walnuts and fresh orange.

instructions.text: Mix dry ingredients; set aside.
Combine eggs, margarine, juice, peel, and water.
Add all at once to flour mixture. Stir until moist.
Stir in walnuts.
Turn into greased and floured 9x5x3 inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Cool before removing from pan.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Bread
recipes.description: Spiced pumpkin bread with cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg - makes 3 loaves.

instructions.text: Mix salad oil, sugar, eggs, and rest.
Use low speed until blended.
Bake 1 hour at 350°F. Makes 3 loaves.

recipes.title: Bisquick Muffins
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe from Bisquick baking mix box
recipes.description: Simple, quick muffins made with Bisquick baking mix.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F. Grease bottoms of 12 medium muffin cups.
Mix ingredients; beat vigorously 30 seconds.
Fill muffin cups 2/3 full.
Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

notes: HIGH ALTITUDE: Heat oven to 425°F instead of 400°F

recipes.title: Bisquick Drop Biscuits
recipes.source_note: Bisquick box recipe with family handwritten copy
recipes.description: Quick and easy drop biscuits with several variations including no-cholesterol, water-only, and rolled versions.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 450°F.
Mix ingredients until dough forms; beat 30 seconds.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.

notes: NO-CHOLESTEROL BISCUITS: Mix 2 1/3 cups baking mix and 2/3 cup skim milk or cold water until dough forms; beat 30 sec. Continue as directed.
WATER RECIPE: Mix 2 1/3 cups baking mix and 2/3 cup cold water until dough forms; beat 30 sec. Continue as directed.

ROLLED BISCUITS: After beating, if dough is too sticky, gradually mix in enough baking mix (up to 1/4 cup) to make dough easy to handle. Turn onto surface well dusted with baking mix; gently roll in baking mix to coat. Shape into ball; knead 10 times. Roll 1/2" thick. Cut with 2" cutter dipped in baking mix. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet as directed. 10 to 12 biscuits.
HIGH ALTITUDE: Heat oven to 475°F. If using water, increase baking mix to 2 1/2 cups.
Family handwritten copy of this recipe exists

missing_inputs: Not in database: Bisquick baking mix

recipes.title: Country Clay Bread
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping by Linda Wasserstein
recipes.description: A soft, homemade yeast bread baked in a clay bread pan. Uses honey or sugar for a slightly sweet flavor.

instructions.text: Dissolve the yeast in 1/2 cup of warm milk in a large bowl and let stand for 5 minutes. Blend in sugar or honey, salt, melted butter and remaining milk.
Stir in flour, one cup at a time, until ingredients are thoroughly blended and will separate easily from sides of bowl.
Turn dough out onto a floured board, lightly coat with flour. Take care not to use too much flour. Knead for 8 to 10 minutes until dough is soft, satiny and no longer sticky.
Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl and turn dough so all sides are coated with oil. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and place in a warm, draft-free location. Allow to rise for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Punch down the dough and turn it out onto the board. Dust dough sparingly with flour and knead for 1 to 2 minutes. Shape into a loaf.
Brush loaf lightly with oil and place in 1 1/2 quart bread pan. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to rise until dough is 1 inch above top of pan (40-60 minutes).
Pre-heat oven to 350°F. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes.
Remove from oven and run a knife or spatula around inside edges of bread pan. Cool loaf on a wire rack.

notes: Originally designed for Copco Country Clay bread pan
Can use honey instead of sugar for slightly different flavor

recipes.title: Biscuits
recipes.description: Classic homemade biscuits with shortening.

instructions.text: Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Cut in shortening until you have coarse meal.
Slowly stir in milk until the dough pulls away from side of bowl.
Put on floured surface, knead 15 to 20 times.
Pat into a circle about 1/2 inch thick.
Cut into biscuits with a glass or biscuit cutter dipped in flour.
Bake at 425°F for 13-15 minutes until edges are brown.

notes: Technique tip: Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse meal - this ensures flaky biscuits
Doneness indicator: Slowly stir in milk until the dough pulls away from side of bowl - don't overmix
Kneading: Only knead 15-20 times on floured surface - overworking makes tough biscuits
Cutting tip: Use a glass or biscuit cutter dipped in flour to prevent sticking
Visual doneness: Bake until edges are golden brown
Handwritten family recipe card - treasured technique passed down through generations

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 66)

recipes.title: Holiday Brandy Bread

recipes.description: Sweet yeast bread shaped into half-moons and brushed with brandy butter, dusted with confectioners' sugar.

instructions.text: [Beginning of instructions missing from clipping]

Return to buttered baking sheets. Let rise in warm place until almost doubled in bulk, about 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake 30 minutes or until loaves are lightly browned and sound hollow when tapped on bottom.
Transfer to wire racks set over baking sheets. In bowl combine remaining brandy and butter; brush over hot loaves.
Cool completely. Sprinkle heavily with confectioners' sugar.

recipes.title: Corn Bread (Aunt Jemima)
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn meal mix package
recipes.description: Classic Southern corn bread using self-rising corn meal mix.

ingredients.item: AUNT JEMIMA Self-Rising Buttermilk Corn Meal Mix

instructions.text: Heat oven to 425°F.
Heat vegetable shortening in 10-inch oven-proof skillet or 8 or 9-inch square baking pan in oven 3 minutes; tilt skillet to coat bottom evenly.
Combine dry ingredients. Add milk and egg; mix until blended.
Add melted shortening; mix well.
Pour into hot skillet; bake 20 to 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

recipes.pan_size: 10-inch skillet or 8-9 inch square baking pan
notes: VARIATION - Muffins or Corn Sticks: Pour batter into 12 greased/paper-lined muffin cups or 21 hot well-greased corn stick pans. Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown.
VARIATION - Buttermilk Corn Bread: Add 1/2 tsp baking soda to dry ingredients. Substitute buttermilk for milk.

VARIATION - Tex-Mex Corn Bread: Stir in one 8-oz can whole kernel corn (drained) and one 4-oz can chopped green chilies (drained). Bake 25-30 minutes. Top with 1/2 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese.

recipes.title: White Bread
recipes.description: Classic homemade white bread loaves.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 2 1/2 cups of the flour and the yeast.
In a saucepan heat and stir milk; sugar; shortening, margarine, or butter; and salt till warm (120° to 130°) and shortening almost melts. Add to flour mixture.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes.

Using a spoon, stir in as much remaining flour as you can. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough of the remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total).
Shape into a ball. Place in a lightly greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover and let rise in a warm place till double (about 45 minutes).
Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide dough in half. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
Lightly grease two 8x4x2-inch loaf pans. Shape each half of dough into a loaf by patting or rolling.
Place shaped dough in prepared loaf pans. Cover and let rise in a warm place till nearly double (30 to 40 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven about 40 minutes or till bread tests done. Cover loosely with foil the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent overbrowning, if necessary.
Remove from pans immediately. Cool on wire racks.

notes: Hand-mixed method available: Soften yeast in 1/4 cup warm water (105-115°). Reduce milk to 2 cups. Increase kneading time to 8-10 minutes.

recipes.title: French Bread
recipes.description: If you're a lover of Italian bread, try our French Bread. The loaves are just a little longer and narrower than the Italian ones.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 2 cups of the flour, the yeast, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Add warm water. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes.

Using a spoon, stir in as much remaining flour as you can. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (8 to 10 minutes total).
Shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover; let rise in a warm place till double (about 1 hour).
Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.
Roll each half into a 15x10-inch rectangle. Roll up from long sides; seal well. Taper ends. Place, seam side down, on a greased baking sheet sprinkled with cornmeal.
Combine egg white and water; brush over loaves. Cover; let rise till nearly double (35 to 45 minutes).
With a very sharp knife, make 3 or 4 diagonal cuts about 1/4 inch deep across top of each loaf.
Bake in a 375° oven for 20 minutes. Brush again with egg white and water mixture. Continue baking for 15 to 20 minutes more or till bread tests done. Remove from baking sheet; cool.

notes: Mini-French-Bread Loaves: Cut each half into quarters (8 pieces). Shape into 6-inch loaves. Bake 15 minutes, brush, continue baking 10-15 minutes. Makes 8 loaves.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 39)

recipes.title: Cheese Bread
recipes.description: Rich cheesy yeast bread - use cheddar, Swiss, or Monterey Jack with jalapeños.

ingredients.prep_note: cheddar, Swiss, or Monterey Jack with jalapeños

instructions.text: Combine 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour and 1 package active dry yeast. Add egg, cheese, warm water, sugar, and salt.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes.
Using 2 1/4 to 3 cups all-purpose flour, stir in as much flour as you can.
Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total).
Shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl; turn once. Cover; let rise in a warm place till double (1 to 1 1/4 hours).
Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.
Lightly grease two 8x4x2-inch loaf pans. Shape each half of dough into a loaf. Place in pans.
Cover; let rise in a warm place till nearly double (about 45 minutes).
Bake in a 350° oven for 40 to 45 minutes or till done. Cover loosely the last 20 minutes, if necessary. Remove from pans; cool.

recipes.title: Whole Wheat Bread
recipes.description: Fiber-filled bread with whole grains

instructions.text: Combine 2 cups of all-purpose flour and the yeast. Heat and stir brown sugar, shortening, 1¾ cups water, and 1 teaspoon salt till warm (120° to 130°) and shortening almost melts. Add to flour mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a spoon, stir in whole wheat flour and as much remaining all-purpose flour as you can.

Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough remaining all-purpose flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). Shape into a ball. Place in a lightly greased bowl; turn once. Cover; let rise in a warm place till double (1 to 1½ hours).

Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover and let rest 10 minutes. Lightly grease two 8x4x2-inch loaf pans. Shape each half of dough into a loaf. Place in pans. Cover; let rise in a warm place till nearly double (45 to 60 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 40 to 45 minutes or till done. Cover loosely with foil the last 10 to 20 minutes, if necessary. Remove from pans; cool.

notes: Wheat Germ Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce whole wheat flour to 1½ cups and add ½ cup toasted wheat germ.
Bran Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce whole wheat flour to 1½ cups and add ½ cup unprocessed wheat bran (miller's bran).
Oatmeal Bread: Prepare as above, except substitute quick-cooking or regular rolled oats for the whole wheat flour. Increase the all-purpose flour to 4¼ to 4¾ cups total.
Buckwheat Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce whole wheat flour to 1¼ cups and add ¾ cup buckwheat flour.
Honey and Whole Wheat Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce water to 1½ cups and omit brown sugar. Add ⅓ cup honey or molasses to saucepan.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for packed brown sugar (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Rye Bread
recipes.description: Orange Rye Bread variation is reminiscent of Swedish limpa

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 2½ cups all-purpose flour, the yeast, water, brown sugar, oil, and salt. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping sides of bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a spoon, stir in rye flour, caraway seed, and as much of the remaining all-purpose flour as you can.

Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough of the remaining all-purpose flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). Shape into a ball. Place in a lightly greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover and let rise in a warm place till double (about 1 hour).

Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide dough in half. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes. Shape into 2 round loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet sprinkled with cornmeal. Flatten each slightly to a 6-inch diameter. (Or, shape each half of dough into a loaf. Place in two greased 8x4x2-inch loaf pans.) Cover and let rise in a warm place till nearly double (30 to 45 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till bread tests done. Remove from baking sheet or pans; cool.

notes: Orange Rye Bread: Prepare as above, except increase brown sugar to ½ cup, omit the caraway seed, and add 4 teaspoons finely shredded orange peel to the flour mixture.
Molasses Rye Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce water to 1½ cups and substitute ½ cup light molasses for the brown sugar.
Peasant Rye Bread: Prepare as above, except reduce rye flour to 1 cup. Stir in ½ cup whole bran cereal and ½ cup yellow cornmeal with rye flour.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for packed brown sugar (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Dark Rye Bread
recipes.description: Heavy, dark, robust bread that will appeal to you if you like Russian black bread or pumpernickel

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 1½ cups of the all-purpose flour, the yeast, coffee crystals, caraway seed, and fennel seed. In a saucepan heat and stir the water, molasses, margarine or butter, unsweetened chocolate, vinegar, sugar, and salt till warm (120° to 130°), and till margarine or butter and chocolate almost melt. Add to flour mixture. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a spoon, stir in rye flour and as much of the remaining all-purpose flour as you can.

Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough remaining all-purpose flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). (Dough may be slightly sticky because of the rye flour.) Shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover; let rise in a warm place till double (1¼ to 1½ hours).

Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes. Shape into 2 round loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet. Flatten each slightly to a 5-inch diameter. Cover and let rise in a warm place till nearly double (30 to 45 minutes). Combine the egg white and 1 tablespoon water; brush over loaves.

Bake in a 375° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till bread tests done. If desired, brush again with egg white and water mixture about 5 minutes before removing from oven. Remove from baking sheet immediately; cool on wire racks.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 41)

recipes.title: Sourdough Bread
recipes.description: A chewy texture and slightly tangy flavor are the hallmarks of Sourdough Bread

instructions.text: Bring Sourdough Starter to room temperature. Combine 2½ cups of the flour and the yeast. Heat and stir water, sugar, margarine, and 1 teaspoon salt just till warm (120° to 130°) and margarine almost melts. Add to flour mixture. Add Sourdough Starter. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes.

Combine 2¼ cups of flour and the soda. Add to yeast mixture. Stir till combined. Using a spoon, stir in as much remaining flour as you can. Turn out onto a floured surface. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough (6 to 8 minutes total). Shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl; turn once. Cover; let rise in warm place till double (45 to 60 minutes).

Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover; let rest 10 minutes. Shape into 2 round loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet. Flatten each slightly to a 6-inch diameter. (Or, shape into two 9x4-inch oblong loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet.) With a sharp knife, make crisscross slashes across tops of loaves. Cover; let rise till nearly double (about 30 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till done. Cover the last 10 minutes, if necessary. Remove from baking sheet; cool.

notes: Raisin Sourdough Bread: Prepare as above, except stir 1½ cups raisins into yeast mixture along with the flour-soda mixture. Before baking, brush loaves with milk. Combine 2 tablespoons sugar and ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon. Sprinkle over loaves.

instructions.text: Mix the 1½ cups flour, the sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and ¼ teaspoon salt. Cut in ½ cup margarine till mixture resembles fine crumbs. Mix Sourdough Starter, egg, and vanilla; add to flour mixture. Stir just till moistened. Spread half of the batter in a greased 9x9x2-inch baking pan.

Spread Cherry Filling atop. Drop remaining batter in small mounds over filling. Mix oats, brown sugar, nuts, and the 3 tablespoons flour. Cut in ¼ cup margarine till mixture resembles coarse crumbs; sprinkle over batter. Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till golden.

Cherry Filling: Bring 1½ cups fresh or frozen unsweetened pitted tart red cherries to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Combine ½ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons cornstarch; add to cherry mixture. Cook and stir till bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Cool completely.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for quick-cooking rolled oats

instructions.text: Cook 3 slices bacon till crisp; drain and crumble. Set bacon aside. Stir together 1¾ cups all-purpose flour, ¼ cup sugar, 2½ teaspoons baking powder, and ¼ teaspoon salt. Make a well in the center.
Combine 1 beaten egg, ½ cup milk, ½ cup Sourdough Starter, and ⅓ cup cooking oil; add to dry mixture all at once. Stir just till moistened.
Stir in bacon and ¼ cup shredded cheddar cheese. Grease muffin cups or line with paper bake cups; fill about ¾ full. Bake in a 400° oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for shredded cheddar cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Dill Batter Bread
recipes.description: A no-knead yeast bread with a somewhat coarse texture

instructions.text: Combine 1 cup flour and the yeast. Heat and stir cottage cheese, sugar, dillseed, margarine, onion, ½ cup water, and ½ teaspoon salt till warm (120° to 130°) and margarine almost melts. Add to flour mixture along with egg. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed 3 minutes.

Using a spoon, stir in wheat germ and remaining flour (batter will be stiff). Spoon into a well-greased 9x1½-inch round baking pan or a 1-quart casserole. Cover; let rise in a warm place till nearly double (50 to 60 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till golden brown. Remove from pan or casserole. Serve warm or cool.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 43)

recipes.title: Egg Bread
recipes.description: The cinnamon-and-sugar-filled Cinnamon-Swirl Bread is great toasted and buttered for breakfast

instructions.text: Combine 2 cups of the flour and the yeast. In a saucepan heat and stir milk, sugar, margarine or butter, and salt till warm (120° to 130°) and margarine almost melts. Add to flour mixture along with eggs. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a spoon, stir in as much remaining flour as you can.

Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough of the remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total). Shape into a ball. Place in a lightly greased bowl; turn once to grease surface. Cover and let rise in a warm place till double (about 60 minutes).

Punch dough down. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide in half. Cover and let rest 10 minutes. Lightly grease two 8x4x2-inch loaf pans. Shape each half of dough into a loaf. Place in pans. Cover and let rise till almost double (about 30 minutes).
Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till done. Cover loosely the last 10 to 15 minutes of baking, if necessary. Remove from pans; cool.
