Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm topped with whipped cream for a delicious dessert.

recipes.title: Candy Cane Muffins
recipes.description: These candy cane muffins make a great Christmas morning treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and peppermint extract. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead. Sprinkle the tops with the crushed candy canes.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add 1/4 cup of cocoa to the batter for chocolate muffins.

recipes.title: Nutella Muffins
recipes.description: Deliciously moist to the last bite, these muffins are sure to disappear quickly.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and Nutella. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: If desired, add 1/4 cup of chopped walnuts to the batter before baking.

recipes.title: Maple Bacon Muffins
recipes.description: These savory muffins are great served warm for breakfast or even a snack.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and maple syrup. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the bacon. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: For a complete breakfast serve with a side of eggs.

recipes.title: Eggnog Muffins
recipes.description: These lightly spiced eggnog muffins are a great holiday treat.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, spices and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, eggnog and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: These muffins freeze well, just pop in the microwave for a couple minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Coconut Muffins
recipes.description: Definitely for coconut lovers - this light, moist muffin is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Mix in the coconut. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Drizzle with chocolate syrup for an added sweet treat.

recipes.title: Peach Muffins
recipes.description: Bursting with plump peaches, these muffins are sure to be hit!

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the peaches. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: The peaches can be replaced with any of your favorite fruit.

missing_inputs: 1 cup fresh peaches, peeled and chopped

recipes.title: Poppy Seed Muffins
recipes.description: These scrumptious muffins are sure to get rave reviews.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, poppy seeds and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Make a quick glaze for your muffins by mixing together a cup of powdered sugar with a couple tablespoons of orange juice.

recipes.title: Orange Cinnamon Muffins
recipes.description: These muffins are packed full of citrus cinnamon goodness.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, orange zest and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Make a quick glaze by mixing two tablespoons of orange juice with a cup of powdered sugar.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Banana Muffins
recipes.description: Moist to the last bite, these make an indulgent teatime snack.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, peanut butter, bananas and vanilla. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add a teaspoon of cinnamon to the batter to spice it up a bit.

recipes.title: Cheesy Corn Muffins
recipes.description: These savory muffins are so filling they could be a light meal on its own.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, cornmeal, cheese, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add half a cup of crumbled bacon to the batter to make an even heartier muffin.

recipes.title: Amaretto Muffins
recipes.description: These light and moist muffins are so quick and easy to prepare.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.

In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and Amaretto. Mix in the almonds. Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add half a cup of chocolate chips to the batter.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter-Banana Bread
recipes.description: A moist banana bread with peanut butter, flaxseed, and a peanut butter glaze.

instructions.text: To prepare bread, combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl; beat with a mixer at medium speed. Add granulated and brown sugars; beat until blended.
Weigh or lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Combine flour and next 5 ingredients (through allspice) in a small bowl.
Add flour mixture to banana mixture; beat just until blended. Stir in nuts.
Pour batter into a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan coated with cooking spray.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour and 5 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Remove from oven; cool 10 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Remove bread from pan; cool.
To prepare glaze, combine powdered sugar, milk, and 1 tablespoon peanut butter in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk. Drizzle glaze over bread.

recipes.title: German Farmer-Style Rye Bread
recipes.description: An authentic German rye bread with a long fermentation for added flavor, using caraway seeds.

instructions.text: Add the ingredients for the starter to a large bowl and mix together until smooth. Set aside for 10 minutes for the yeast to activate.
While the starter is resting, mix together the remaining ingredients except for the oil and cornmeal.

Pour the flour mixture over the starter. Do not stir. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a clean towel and set aside for at least two hours and up to five hours. The starter will bubble up through the flour mixture.

Add the oil to the flour mixture and use a wooden spoon to stir the flour mixture into the starter. As the mixture comes together, remove the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead for about 10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Set the dough aside to rest for about 10 minutes, then knead for another 5 to 10 minutes.

Set the dough in a large, lightly oiled bowl and lightly oil the top of the dough. Cover with plastic wrap or a clean towel and set in a draft-free area of the kitchen to rise until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
Remove the dough to a lightly floured work surface. Punch down the dough and lightly knead it 3 or 4 times. Form into a ball, return to the bowl, cover and let rise for another 45 minutes or so.
Preheat oven to 450°F and set the shelf at the lowest level. Put a small metal pan in the oven.
Lightly press down on the dough and form it into a ball. Sprinkle the cornmeal onto a baking sheet and set the dough onto the baking sheet, with any seams on the bottom.
Lightly oil the top of the dough and cover it with plastic wrap. Set aside to rise for another hour.

Use a sharp knife or razor blade to slash the top of the dough in 3 parallel lines, each about 1/4-inch deep. Then slash with another set of 3 lines perpendicular to the first set. Use a spray bottle to mist the dough with water.

Set the baking sheet in the oven and pour about 1 cup of water into the small pan to create steam. Shut the door immediately and bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 400°F and bake for another 35 to 45 minutes. (An insta-read thermometer inserted into the middle of the loaf should register 190°F.)
Set the loaf on a cooling rack and let cool completely.

recipes.title: Garlic-Cilantro Naan Bread
recipes.description: Soft Indian-style flatbread topped with fresh garlic and cilantro, baked on a baking stone.

instructions.text: In a glass measuring cup, combine the yeast and sugar. Add the water and stir well. Let rest until foamy, about 5 minutes.

Sift the flour and salt together into a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the flour and pour in the yeast mixture, eggs, yogurt, and 1/4 cup ghee or oil. Mix together with your fingers until a smooth dough forms, working in a small amount of additional flour if needed. Knead for 3 minutes.
Oil a small bowl with the remaining 1 teaspoon ghee or oil. Place the dough in the bowl, turning to coat; cover with plastic wrap and let rest in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Place a baking stone in the bottom of the oven and preheat oven to 400°F. Divide the dough into 6 pieces and gently roll into balls. Gently roll each ball into a 6-inch circle on a lightly floured surface.

Brush each circle with ghee or vegetable oil (about 2 teaspoons total) and top evenly with 1/4 cup finely chopped fresh cilantro and 4 cloves of garlic, finely chopped. Gently press the cilantro and garlic into the dough so they adhere.
Bake dough on the baking stone in batches until just golden brown and puffed, 8 to 10 minutes.
You should be able to bake two naan at a time on an average size baking stone. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Focaccia Bread
recipes.description: Classic Italian focaccia with olive oil, Italian herbs, and topped with Parmesan and mozzarella cheese.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together the flour, salt, sugar, yeast, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, basil and black pepper. Mix in the vegetable oil and water.
When the dough has pulled together, turn it out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead until smooth and elastic. Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, and turn to coat with oil.
Cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for 20 minutes.
Preheat oven to 450°F. Punch dough down; place on greased baking sheet. Pat into a 1/2 inch thick rectangle. Brush top with olive oil. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and mozzarella cheese.
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Ukrainian Babka Bread
recipes.description: Rich Ukrainian Easter bread with golden raisins, lemon zest, and a buttery texture.

instructions.text: Make the dough: Coat a large bowl with oil and set aside. Combine the milk, yeast, the 1 tablespoon sugar, and 1 cup flour in a small bowl and set aside.

In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the remaining 6 cups flour, remaining sugar, salt, lemon zest, and raisins. With the mixer on low speed, add vanilla, egg yolks, 2 eggs, and the yeast mixture.

Mix on low speed until a smooth, elastic dough forms -- about 10 minutes. Add the 1/2 cup butter and mix for 5 more minutes. Transfer the dough to the prepared bowl, turning to coat all sides with oil. Cover the bowl with a clean, damp kitchen towel and set dough aside to rise in a warm, draft-free place until it doubles in volume -- about 1 hour.
Shape the loaf: Coat two 8-inch round by 4-inch-deep baking dishes with remaining butter and lightly dust with the 2 tablespoons flour, shaking out any excess. Set aside.

Punch down the dough, transfer it to a lightly floured surface, and divide it in half. Shape each half into a ball and place them in the prepared dishes. Cover with a clean, damp kitchen towel and let rise in a warm place until dough doubles in volume -- about 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350°F.

Bake the bread: Beat the remaining egg and lightly brush the top of babkas. Bake in the lower third of the oven for 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 300°F and continue to bake until the loaves are golden and sound hollow when tapped -- about 40 more minutes.
Transfer the finished loaves to a wire rack to cool.

recipes.pan_size: Two 8-inch round by 4-inch deep baking dishes

recipes.title: Dutch Paasbrood
recipes.description: Traditional Dutch Easter bread with almond paste filling, golden raisins, and candied lemon peel.

instructions.text: Make the dough: Coat a large bowl with oil and set aside. Warm 1 cup of milk to 110°F in a small saucepan. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the yeast and the 1 tablespoon of sugar and let stand until bubbly.

In a large bowl or the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade, combine the flour and cardamom. Add the whole eggs, butter, and yeast mixture and pulse to combine. Process the mixture or stir with a wooden spoon until a firm, sticky dough forms.

Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface, knead lightly, shape it into a ball, and transfer it to the prepared bowl, turning to coat all sides with oil. Cover the bowl with a clean, damp kitchen towel and let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place until it doubles in volume -- about 40 minutes.

Make the almond paste: Place the almonds, remaining sugar, egg yolks, and lemon juice in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process into a firm paste. Place the almond paste on a 20-inch-long piece of plastic wrap. Roll the paste up lengthwise in the plastic wrap, twist the ends to seal, and shape the paste into a log about 1 inch thick and 12 inches long and refrigerate.

Shape the loaf: Preheat oven to 400°F. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Place the raisins, lemon peel, and zest in the center of the dough and knead until they are incorporated and the dough is smooth. Roll the dough into a 6- by 13-inch rectangle.

Unwrap the almond paste and place it lengthwise in the center of the dough. Fold the dough over the paste and pinch to seal. Place the loaf, seal-side down, on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Cover the loaf and allow it to rise until it doubles in volume -- about 30 minutes.

Bake the bread: Glaze the loaf with the remaining milk and bake for 10 minutes in the center of the oven. Reduce temperature to 325°F and bake until loaf is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped -- 40 to 45 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Serve at room temperature.

recipes.title: Cuban-Style Bread
recipes.description: Authentic Cuban bread with a distinctive seam created using palmetto leaves or shoestrings.

instructions.text: In a mixing machine fitted with a dough hook, add the water, salt, sugar, shortening, and yeast.
Add the flour slowly, making a stiff dough that is silky smooth.
Turn dough out into a large oiled bowl, cover with a cloth. Place dough in a warm place, and allow to double in bulk.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Pound and knead the dough, until it is silky smooth. Return the dough to the bowl, cover, and let rise again, until doubled in bulk.
Meanwhile, sterilize the palmetto leaves or shoe strings by soaking them in boiling water.

Portion dough into 10-ounce loaves. As a loaf is formed, immediately place a palmetto leaf or shoestring down the length of the loaf, and turn the loaf over onto a baking sheet, leaf/string side down. Repeat with the remaining loaves.
Let the dough rise, leaf side down, for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Bake loaves until they are golden brown, about 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Asian Poori Bread
recipes.description: Traditional Indian deep-fried puffed bread with cardamom and whole wheat flour.

instructions.text: Sift flours and salt into a medium bowl; add any bran remaining in sifter. Stir in cardamom seeds and 1 tablespoon oil; mix in enough of the water to make a soft dough.
Knead dough 5 minutes on a lightly oiled surface, with a little oil rubbed into hands to prevent them from sticking, until dough is soft and pliable. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest 10 minutes.
Divide dough into 8 pieces; roll into balls. Dust balls with flour and cover with a damp cloth. Roll each ball out to a 3-inch round, keeping unrolled balls and finished rounds covered with a cloth.
Half-fill a deep pan or deep-fryer with oil and heat to 375°F or until a 1-inch bread cube browns in 50 seconds.
Fry poori one at a time, turning over once, for 30-60 seconds. Keep patting top of poories gently with a slotted spoon as they cook in order to make them puff up. Serve at once.

recipes.title: Blackbread
recipes.description: Dense, hearty dark rye bread with caraway seeds, perfect for slicing thin.

instructions.text: Mix the yeast, 1 tablespoon water and sugar in a large bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients in the order given. Beat well.
Put the dough on a floured board and knead well. Let rise on the board in a warm place until doubled in bulk.
Knead well again and shape into loaves. (5 small loaves are better than 3 standard-sized ones if you have pans smaller than 9 × 5 × 3.)
Put into greased pans and return to warm place to rise until again doubled in size.
Bake 10 minutes in a preheated 425° oven, then lower the heat to 325° and bake 1 hour more.
Slice very thin.

recipes.title: Jalapeño Cheese Bread
recipes.description: A savory yeast bread loaded with cheddar, Parmesan, and jalapeños with English mustard.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, mix the flour, cheeses, mustard powder, salt, jalapeños and yeast. Make a well in the middle and add the milk to make a soft, sticky dough.
Knead the dough on a light, floured surface until elastic and smooth.
Oil a large bowl and put the dough into the bowl, covering with oiled cling film, and leave in a warm(er the better) place for one and a half hours to rise.
Turn the dough onto the floured surface and knead again for another couple of minutes.
Oil a baking tray, and shape the dough into your chosen shape, and cover with well-oiled cling film and leave to rise for another half an hour.
Remove the cling film, glaze the loaf with beaten egg yolk, if you like at this point you can score the top with a criss-cross pattern or slashes, and then scatter the cheese over the top.

Bake in a preheated fan oven at 210°C (Gas mark 8) for ten minutes, then turn the temperature down to 180°C for a further 20 minutes. If the top starts to brown too much, you can cover it with tin foil loosely to prevent burning.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: Irish Soda Bread
recipes.description: Traditional Irish soda bread with raisins, dates, orange zest, and honey - no yeast required.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, raisins, and dates until combined and the raisins and dates are coated in the flour mixture. Grate the butter over the bowl on the largest hole setting, pausing and stirring the mixture every 10 seconds or so to coat the butter pieces in the flour mixture. Set aside.

In a small bowl, whisk together the egg, buttermilk, orange zest, and honey until the honey has dissolved into the liquid. Add the buttermilk mixture to the flour mixture and knead it together with your hands until a dough forms.

Take the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead it for 3-4 turns, or until it comes together and has smoothed out a bit. Shape the dough into a ball, cover it, and place it in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Remove the dough from the refrigerator, uncover it, and place it on a lightly greased 9-inch baking pan, patting it a couple times so it is slightly flattened on top.
Use a sharp knife to score a 1-inch deep cross in the top of the dough right before placing it in the oven.

Bake for 40-50 minutes, or until it's golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted into the dough comes out clean. Remove from the oven and allow to cool to room temperature before slicing and serving.

recipes.title: Olive French Bread
recipes.description: Crusty French-style bread studded with Nicoise olives, baked with steam for a crispy crust.

instructions.text: Insert the dough hook into an electric mixer and on 1 or low speed, combine 5 cups flour and the water for 4 minutes. Sprinkle the yeast over the dough, turn the speed to 2, and mix about 5 minutes longer. (Dough will pull cleanly away from the bowl.)
Toss the olives with the 2 teaspoons flour, add to the dough with the salt and mix 2 minutes longer.
Remove the bowl from the mixer, cover with a clean tea towel, and let rest for 15 minutes.
Turn the dough out on a heavily floured surface, lightly knead into a ball, and let rest, covered for 45 minutes.
Punch out the air, cut the dough in half, and shape into two baguettes. Place the loaves on one or two baking trays, sprinkle with flour, cover with the towel, and let rest for 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
With a single edge razor blade or a very sharp knife, make a slash down the center of each loaf.

Carefully slide the breads onto a baking stone and bake 10 minutes. Spray with water (a spray can or bottle used for misting plants works well) and continue baking until the bread is well-browned, about 1 hour and 10 minutes longer. (Baking at 400°F will give you a crustier bread, but you can bake the bread at 425°F for 1 hour, 10 minutes.)
Cool on a rack.

notes: Makes 2 loaves

recipes.title: Koulouri-Cypriot Village Bread
recipes.description: Traditional Cypriot bread coated with sesame and caraway seeds, flavored with fennel and cumin.

instructions.text: Grind the fennel seeds with a pestle and mortar or in a spice grinder.

Put the flour, salt, yeast, olive oil, and water in a large bowl and whisk together. Make sure not to pour the yeast directly on top of the salt, since salt is not good for active yeast. Add the fennel powder and knead for 5 minutes, or use the dough hook on your stand mixer for about 3 minutes.
Let dough stand in the bowl for at least 1 hour, until almost doubled in size.
Mix the seeds and cumin in a large bowl and dampen with warm water – this helps the seeds release their flavor.
Line a baking sheet with parchment or a silicone liner.

Take the dough out of the bowl and shape into a ball, dusting your surface with flour as necessary. Coat the ball of dough with the seeds in the bowl. Place on baking sheet and let rise for another hour.

Preheat oven to 425°F. Use a sharp knife or razor to make a cut around the edge of the dough and to make two parallel cuts on top (these cuts are optional, but definitely add some interesting shape and variety to the bread).
Bake the bread for 25-30 minutes, until golden brown and hollow-sounding when rapped on the bottom. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

recipes.title: Portuguese Sweet Bread
recipes.description: Traditional Portuguese sweet bread with a golden egg glaze, perfect for breakfast or holidays.

instructions.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl.
Stir in milk, 3/4 cup sugar, 3 eggs, salt, margarine or butter, and 3 cups of flour.
Beat until smooth. Stir in enough of the remaining flour to make the dough easy to handle.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic - about 5 minutes.
Place in a greased bowl and let rise in a warm place until it is double in size - about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Punch down dough and divide in half. Shape each half into a round slightly flat loaf.
Place each loaf into a well greased round 9" x 1 1/2" pan. Cover and let rise until double (a/b an hour).
Heat oven to 350°F. Beat 1 egg and brush over tops of loaves.
Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of sugar. Bake until loaves are golden brown, about 35-45 minutes.

recipes.title: Caramel Bacon Monkey Bread
recipes.description: A low-carb monkey bread made with Swerve sweetener, topped with bacon and homemade caramel sauce.

instructions.text: Bread: Preheat oven to 375°F and grease a bundt pan well. In a small bowl, mix together cinnamon and sweetener.
Follow Maria's directions regarding the bread (I used only half the sweetener and half the salt), up to the point of mixing the dough together and giving it a few moments to thicken up.
Roll dough into 1-inch balls and place half of them in the prepared bundt pan (you may need to wet your hands a few times to keep the dough from sticking). Sprinkle with half of the cinnamon mixture.
Repeat with remaining dough and cinnamon mixture.
Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes, until puffed and browned and a tester inserted down into the center comes out clean. Let cool 15 minutes in pan.

Caramel Sauce: While the bread is baking, make the caramel sauce. Combine butter and sweeteners in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook about 3 minutes. If using all Swerve, you may find that your caramel remains lighter in colour (you can add a tsp of molasses for caramel colour and it will only add 6 g of carbs to the entire recipe).
Add heavy cream and vanilla extract. Mixture will bubble vigorously, this is normal. Sprinkle with xanthan gum and whisk vigorously to combine. Stir in salt.
Let cool to lukewarm and then whisk in water to combine.
To Assemble: Flip bread out onto a serving platter and drizzle with caramel sauce. Sprinkle with chopped bacon and serve warm.

recipes.title: Blueberry Coconut Muffins
recipes.description: Light and fluffy muffins with fresh blueberries and shredded coconut.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. In a medium bowl, mix flour, sugars, and baking powder.
In another bowl, lightly mix milk and yogurt.
Add egg, oil, and vanilla to wet mixture. Be careful not to over mix.
Make a well in dry mixture and add wet mixture. Gently fold together.
Add blueberries and coconut to dough and combine until just blended.
Fill greased and floured muffin tins about 3/4 full. Bake for 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: Raspberry Lemon Muffins
recipes.description: Tangy lemon muffins studded with fresh raspberries and vanilla pudding for extra moisture.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line muffin tins with paper liners.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and pudding.
Lightly whisk eggs in another bowl. Add buttermilk, vanilla, and oil. Zest lemons and set aside. Juice lemons and add to wet mixture.
Combine wet and dry mixtures, fold together being careful not to over mix. Add lemon zest and fold in raspberries.
Fill muffin tins about 3/4 full and bake for about 20 minutes or until done in the middle.

missing_inputs: 1 large box cook and serve vanilla pudding

recipes.title: Traditional Blueberry Muffins
recipes.description: Classic buttermilk blueberry muffins with optional walnuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease muffin tins with shortening.
Combine flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a bowl.
In another bowl, combine sugar with egg and vanilla. Once butter is cooled, add to sugar mixture. Add buttermilk.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and just combine.
Batter will be slightly lumpy. Fold in blueberries and walnuts.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin tins and bake until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean, about 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Banana Nut Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Hearty whole wheat muffins with mashed bananas, oats, and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Prepare muffin tins by greasing with shortening or filling with muffin papers.
In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine sugars with egg and oil. Add yogurt and bananas to wet mixture.
Combine wet ingredients with dry ingredients until just mixed. Overworking the batter will cause the batter to be too hard.
Add oats and pecans. Spoon batter into muffin tins.
Bake for about 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out of the center clean.

recipes.title: Morning Start Blueberry Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.description: Wholesome breakfast muffins with blueberries, oats, and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. In one bowl, combine flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
In another bowl, combine sugar, egg, and vanilla. Add yogurt and milk to wet ingredients.
Combine wet ingredients with dry and fold in blueberries, oats, and pecans until just mixed.
Fill muffin tins with batter until about 3/4 from the top.
Bake for about 20 minutes or until done in the middle and golden brown on the top.

recipes.title: Tea Time Mini Muffins
recipes.description: Adorable mini muffins topped with fresh berries, perfect for tea parties.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, lightly whisk egg with buttermilk. Add cooled butter to mixture.
In a medium bowl, combine flour, white sugar, baking powder, and salt. Fold in wet ingredients until just mixed.
Grease a mini sized muffin tin. Using a small cookie scoop, spoon batter into muffin cups. Top each cup with various berries.
Bake for approximately 10-15 minutes, depending on size. Cool and serve for tea party or as appetizers.

recipes.title: Chai Spiced Muffins
recipes.description: Warmly spiced muffins with cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and allspice - perfect for cozy days.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugars, baking powder, salt, and spices.
In another bowl, lightly whisk egg, vanilla, milk, and oil. Combine all ingredients together and lightly mix.
Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
These muffins are perfect for cozy days at home with something warm to drink!

recipes.title: Chocolate Covered Banana Muffins
recipes.description: Decadent banana muffins loaded with chocolate pudding and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease muffin tins with shortening or use muffin papers. Set aside.
Place bananas in a small microwave safe bowl and microwave for about 2 minutes to help release juices. Don't be afraid to use black or bruised bananas! Mash with a fork and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, and pudding mix.
When bananas are cooled, add egg, butter, and sugar. Gradually add milk and vanilla. Combine well with flour mixture, adding chocolate chips while you gently mix.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin tins and bake for about 20 minutes. Cool and serve.

recipes.title: Chocolate Raspberry Date Night Muffins
recipes.description: Romantic chocolate muffins with almond extract, lemon zest, chocolate chips, and fresh raspberries.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Prepare muffin tins by lining with paper cups or greasing with shortening.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and chocolate pudding mix.
In a small bowl, lightly whisk egg with sugar, buttermilk, almond and vanilla extract. Add cooled butter.
Zest one lemon and add to butter mixture. Create a well in dry ingredients and combine wet and dry. Add chocolate chips and raspberries.
Bake for about 20 minutes or until done in the middle.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Spiced Muffins
recipes.description: Fall-inspired muffins with canned pumpkin, applesauce, and cinnamon sugar topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Prepare muffin tins with paper cups or grease with shortening.
In a small bowl, combine canned pumpkin with applesauce and oil. In another bowl, combine egg with milk.
In a large bowl, mix dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice.
Add egg mixture and pumpkin mixture to dry ingredients. Lightly stir until just combined.
Using a cookie scoop, fill muffin tins until about 3/4 from top. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar on top of each muffin.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean.

recipes.title: Chocolate Lovers Muffins
recipes.description: Triple chocolate muffins with cocoa, chocolate pudding, and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Prepare muffin tins by greasing with shortening.
In a small bowl, combine chocolate pudding with buttermilk, egg, and vanilla.
Add cooled butter and sugar. In another bowl, combine dry ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Fold in wet ingredients and stir to combine. Add chocolate chips.
Scoop batter into muffin tins and bake for 20-25 minutes.

recipes.title: Healthy Bran Apple Muffins
recipes.description: Wholesome whole wheat muffins with wheat bran, Granny Smith apples, and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Prepare muffin tins by greasing with cooking spray or use muffin papers.
Chop 1/2 cup pecans and set aside. Reserve the other half cup as whole pecans.
In a large bowl, combine flour, bran, salt, and baking powder.
In another bowl, combine egg, brown sugar, and applesauce. Add milk, yogurt, and oil.
Combine egg mixture with flour mixture. Add chopped apples and 1/2 cup chopped pecans. Combine well.
Spoon batter into muffin cups and top each with a whole pecan. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Serve warm with honey or honey butter.

recipes.title: Honey Bran Muffins
recipes.description: Naturally sweetened bran muffins with honey and raisins.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine flour, bran, salt, baking powder, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
Combine honey and butter together with a fork.
When smooth, add buttermilk and eggs. Bring flour mixture and honey mixture together and stir till just combined.
Add raisins and combine.
Spoon batter into greased muffin tins. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean. Cool and serve.

recipes.title: Chocolate Peppermint Brownie Muffins
recipes.description: Brownie-style muffins with peppermint extract and crushed candy canes - perfect for the holidays.

ingredients.item: mini chocolate chips or chocolate shavings

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line muffin tins with paper muffin cups.
In a medium bowl, combine brownie mix, eggs, water, and oil. Add peppermint extract and semi sweet chocolate chips.
Spoon batter into muffin tins and top each muffin with a sprinkling of crushed candy canes and either mini chocolate chips or chocolate shavings.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean. Cool and serve.

missing_inputs: 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips or chocolate shavings

recipes.title: Cinnamon and Spice Muffins
recipes.description: These spiced muffins are great for breakfast, teatime or just a snack on the go.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, spices and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla.
Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Add half a cup of your favorite nuts to the batter before baking.

recipes.title: Lemon Raspberry Almond Muffins
recipes.description: These muffins have a lovely tart flavor from the pairing of lemon and raspberry.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter, lemon zest and almond extract.
Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the raspberries and almonds. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Replace the raspberry with poppy seeds for lemon poppy muffins.

recipes.title: Apple White Chocolate Muffins
recipes.description: In this divine muffin recipe, the classic pairing of apple and cinnamon are enhanced by white chocolate.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and vanilla.
Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the apple and white chocolate chips. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: Serve warm, topped with whipped cream.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter and Jelly Muffins
recipes.description: A childhood favorite in a ready to go muffin; kids will love these.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk, butter and peanut butter.
Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Do not beat the mixture.
Distribute half the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead. Next drop a teaspoon of jam into each cup and cover with the remaining batter.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: These freeze well and make a great quick breakfast or snack, just pop in the microwave for a minute.

recipes.title: Bacon Cheese Muffins
recipes.description: These delightful muffins are a perfect addition to any breakfast table.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat the egg and add the milk and butter. Mix in the cheese.
Pour into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix quickly to combine, about 10 seconds. Fold in the bacon. Do not over mix.
Pour the batter into paper lined muffin pan cups or a greased muffin pan can be used instead.
Bake until the tops are golden, about 20 minutes.

notes: For a different texture and flavor, substitute cornmeal for half the flour.

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.description: Simple banana bread that is moist to the last bite and bursting with banana flavor.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. Set aside.
Sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Set aside.
Cream the sugar and butter together until light and fluffy. Add the bananas and eggs and beat well.
Add the banana mixture to the dry ingredients and stir to combine.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before slicing.

notes: Spread slices with honey to serve
recipes.source_note: Reference cookbook - Other Delicious Breakfast Meals

recipes.title: Applesauce Bread
recipes.description: I make this applesauce bread recipe with plump raisins and crunchy nuts. My kids love a slice in their lunch box or as a snack after school.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add egg and applesauce; mix well. Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cloves. Stir into creamed mixture just until moistened. Fold in raisins and walnuts.

Pour into a greased 8x4-in. loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 60-65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Applesauce Muffins
recipes.description: Cinnamon-sugar-dusted applesauce muffins are the tender, homey treat you can stir together in just 10 minutes. The warm allspice, cinnamon and cloves will perfume your kitchen with an autumnal aroma as they bake.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, five to seven minutes. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Stir in the applesauce. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and spices, then stir that dry mixture into the creamed mixture. Fold in the walnuts, if you're using them.

Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-quarters full. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Let the muffins cool in the pan for five minutes before removing them to wire racks. Sprinkle the tops with cinnamon sugar, if desired.

recipes.title: Chicken Spring Rolls
recipes.description: Our fresh chicken spring rolls are light and refreshing. We make them easy with bagged broccoli coleslaw mix, crispy chow mein noodles and slow-cooked chicken.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breast halves

instructions.text: Place the chicken in a 3-quart slow cooker. In a small bowl, whisk the soy sauce, ketchup, honey, ginger and oil together, then stir in the onion. Pour the sauce over the chicken.
Cook the chicken, covered, on low for three to four hours or until the chicken is tender.
Remove the chicken and shred it with two forks. Refrigerate the shredded chicken until you're ready to assemble the spring rolls.

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water until they're smooth, then gradually stir the slurry into the soy sauce and honey mixture. Cook the sauce, covered, on high until it's thickened, 20 to 30 minutes. Editor's Tip: To reduce and thicken the sauce faster, transfer the soy sauce and honey mixture to a saucepan and bring it to a simmer. Stir in the cornstarch mixture. Let it simmer for a minute or two until it thickens.
Toss the chicken with 3/4 cup of sauce, and reserve the remaining sauce for serving.

Fill a large shallow dish partway with warm water. Dip a rice paper wrapper into the water just until it's pliable, about 10 to 15 seconds (do not let it soften completely), then allow excess water to drip off. Place the wrapper on a flat surface. Editor's Tip: Have your work station (a dish of water, the rice papers, the filling ingredients and a serving plate) set up before you start. Work with one rice paper wrapper at a time, dipping it into warm water, rotating and wetting both sides completely. It should be still somewhat firm when you remove it from the water. Avoid soaking the rice paper for too long or it may get too soft, limp and sticky. The wrapper will continue to soften and become pliable as it sits on the work surface. You can place a damp kitchen towel on your working surface and wrap directly on the towel to soak up excess water from the dipped rice paper.

Layer 1/4 cup of coleslaw mix, 1/3 cup of chicken mixture and 1 tablespoon of noodles across the bottom third of the wrapper. Fold in both sides of the wrapper; fold the bottom over the filling, then roll it up tightly. Place the roll on a serving plate, seam side down. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Serve the chicken spring rolls with the reserved sauce. Allow some space between the spring rolls as you transfer them to the serving plate, otherwise, they'll stick to each other and rip when you try to separate them. As you're assembling, cover the wrapped rolls with a damp kitchen towel or paper towel to keep them from drying out. Editor's Tip: Wrapping spring rolls is similar to wrapping burritos. When assembling, leave space between the filling and side edges so the side edges can be folded over the filling. Loosely wrapped rolls may fall apart as you eat them. To make a tighter roll, gently pull the spring roll towards you as you're rolling it away from you. If the rice paper rips as you're wrapping, start again and transfer the filling to a freshly rehydrated rice paper; or place the ripped roll on top of a fresh wrapper and give it a double wrap.

recipes.title: Zucchini Carrot Bread
recipes.description: This moist, easy-to-make zucchini bread includes carrots to keep it from being too sweet. Slip a slice into the kids’ lunchboxes, or take it on a hike or picnic.

instructions.text: Take two carrots and peel them before shredding. You can use a potato peeler or cheese grater to shred. You’ll need about two medium-size carrots to get 3/4 cup shredded.
Without peeling the skin, use a potato peeler to shred a zucchini. You should have 3/4 cup of shredded zucchini, about what you’ll get from one small zucchini.
Use butter or coconut oil to grease and flour two 8x4-inch loaf pans, then set them aside. Pre-heat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, combine the applesauce, carrots, zucchini, sugar, eggs, pumpkin pie spice, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a small bowl.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the carrot and zucchini mixture, adding orange juice as you go.
Using a large spoon or silicone spatula, pour the batter into the loaf pans, taking care to distribute it evenly.
Bake the bread at 350° until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Roll Macarons
recipes.description: These macarons are a fall and winter staple for me. Inspired by the classic cinnamon roll, they are a delicious treat for a cold or snowy day. These pair well with a mug of tea, and can be eaten as a dessert or just a snack. Other fillings would work well with this

instructions.text: Place egg whites in a small bowl; let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Sift almond flour, 1-1/4 cups confectioners' sugar and cinnamon together twice.
Preheat oven to 325°. Beat egg whites on medium speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating on high until stiff peaks form. Fold in almond flour mixture.

With a pastry bag, pipe 1-in.-diameter cookies 2 in. apart onto parchment-lined baking sheets. Bake until lightly browned and firm to the touch, 9-12 minutes. Keeping cookies on the parchment, transfer to wire racks; cool completely.

For filling, in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until creamy. Beat in vanilla. Gradually beat in confectioners’ sugar until fluffy. Refrigerate until mixture firms to a spreading consistency, about 10 minutes.
Spread about 1/4 teaspoon filling onto the bottom of each of half of the cookies; top with remaining cookies. Sprinkle with additional cinnamon. Store in airtight containers in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Feta ‘n’ Chive Muffins
recipes.description: This is a spring variation on the savory muffins my husband has made for years. It has a light texture almost like a popover and tastes best eaten hot right from the oven.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, combine the eggs, milk and butter; stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in the feta cheese and chives.

Fill 12 greased or paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake at 400° for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Serve warm. Refrigerate leftovers.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Banana Bread
recipes.description: Allergic to gluten? We got you! Our gluten-free banana bread recipe bakes two tender, moist loaves that taste just like the original.

ingredients.item: 2 cups gluten-free all-purpose baking flour (without xanthan gum)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda and salt.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, bananas, sugar, applesauce, oil and vanilla. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients just until moistened.
Pour the batter into two greased 8x4-inch loaf pans. Sprinkle the tops of each with the walnuts.

Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 45 to 55 minutes. Cool the loaves in their pans for 10 minutes. Remove the loaves from the pans and put them on wire racks. Let them cool completely to room temperature.

recipes.title: Healthy Avocado Pineapple Muffins
recipes.description: These healthy muffins are a real treat for breakfast, lunch or a coffee break. The avocado adds an extra-special touch. They are delicious served warm from the oven, and they also freeze well. The muffins would be a nice touch for breakfast on St. Patrick’s Day.

ingredients.item: 1 can (8 ounces) unsweetened crushed pineapple, undrained

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375º. In a large bowl, beat avocado until only small lumps remain. Add eggs, honey and oil; beat until blended. Stir in pineapple. In another bowl, whisk flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Add to avocado mixture; stir just until moistened. Fold in 1/2 cup pecans.

Fill 12 greased or foil-lined muffin cups; sprinkle tops with remaining 1/4 cup pecans. Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 20-25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Herb Quick Bread
recipes.description: This simple bread is especially good with soups and stews, but slices are also tasty alongside fresh green salads. The herbs make it a flavorful treat any time of the year.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. In a large bowl, whisk together first 7 ingredients. In another bowl, whisk together egg, milk and oil. Add to flour mixture; stir just until moistened.
Transfer to a 9x5-in. loaf pan coated with cooking spray. Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 40-50 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool.

recipes.title: Herb & Sun-Dried Tomato Muffins
recipes.description: Mom served these muffins instead of bread or buns. Now I make them to serve with soup or chili.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon snipped fresh dill or 1/4 teaspoon dill weed
1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme or 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/2 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, finely chopped

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°. In a large bowl, mix first 7 ingredients. In another bowl, whisk egg, milk and oil. Add to flour mixture; stir just until moistened. Fold in cheese and tomatoes.
Fill 12 greased muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Cabbage Rolls
recipes.description: Call them old-fashioned, but these stuffed cabbage rolls are just as cozy and comforting as they've always been. Once you've got the hang of the rolling technique, you can stuff them with just about anything.

ingredients.item: 1/2 teaspoon snipped fresh dill or dill weed

instructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and (gently) drop in the entire head of cabbage. Cook the cabbage in boiling water just until the outer leaves pull easily away from the head. Using tongs, remove and set aside 12 large leaves for your rolls. Remove the remaining cabbage from the pot, and set it aside. Editor's Tip: Before cooking the cabbage, remove the main portion of the stem. With a paring knife, pointing the knife towards the center of the cabbage, cut around the stem so that you're removing a cone-shaped piece. Check out the video to see what the cabbage will look like once you do this.

In a small bowl, combine the beef, pork, 1/2 cup of tomato sauce, onion, rice, parsley, salt, dill and cayenne, and mix well. (Clean hands are the best tool here!) Editor's Tip: Making the filling and the sauce while the cabbage cooks is a great time saver. If you're unsure about your seasonings, cook up a tiny piece, taste it and adjust the seasonings accordingly.

Cut out the thick vein from the bottom of each leaf, making a V-shaped cut. Editor's Tip: You can also shave off the toughest part of the stem, making it more flexible without fully removing it. Start at the thinnest part of the vein on the exterior side of the leaf, and carefully run a paring knife towards the bottom of the leaf, shaving off the thickest part.

Place about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture in the center of a cabbage leaf. Overlap the cut ends, and fold in the sides. Beginning from the cut end, roll up the leaves into a cute little envelope. Repeat with remaining leaves.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Slice the remaining cabbage and place it in a Dutch oven, lining the bottom. Arrange the cabbage rolls, with the seam side down, over the sliced cabbage. Combine the tomatoes, sugar and remaining tomato sauce, and pour it over the rolls. Editor's Tip: A Dutch oven is one of the best things to have in a kitchen. It's sturdy and cooks food evenly. And our Test Kitchen's picks for the best Dutch oven brands can be used for a wide variety of recipes.
Cover the Dutch oven and bake the cabbage rolls until the they're tender, about 1 hour and 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.description: These pumpkin oatmeal muffins aren't just healthy and virtuous. They're enough of a treat to enjoy for their own sweet sake, especially in pumpkin season.

ingredients.item: 1 large egg, room temperature, lightly beaten

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, pumpkin pie spice, salt and baking soda. In a separate bowl combine the egg, pumpkin, milk and oil. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, and stir until they’re just mixed. Stir in the oats and raisins.

Grease 18 muffin cups or line them with paper muffin cups, and fill them two-thirds full with the muffin batter. In a small bowl, combine the remaining brown sugar, flour and pie spice, then cut in the butter to make a crumbly mixture. Sprinkle 1 rounded teaspoon of the topping over each muffin.
Bake the muffins until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes.
Let the muffins cool in the pan for five minutes before removing them to a wire rack. The muffins are best when served fresh and warm.

recipes.title: Southwest Egg Rolls
recipes.description: Moderately crispy with a rich and creamy filling, these semi-spicy appetizers taste like they’ve been fried.

ingredients.item: 2 tablespoons finely chopped sweet red pepper
1/4 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
3/4 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese or reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend

instructions.text: In a large skillet, saute the spinach, onion, red pepper and jalapeno in oil until tender. Stir in the corn, beans and seasonings; heat through. Remove from the heat. Stir in shredded cheese and cream cheese until melted.

Position a wonton wrapper with one point toward you. (Keep remaining wrappers covered with a damp paper towel until ready to use.) Place 2 teaspoons of filling in the center of wrapper. Fold bottom corner over filling; fold sides toward center over filling. Roll toward the remaining point. Moisten top corner with water; press to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.
Place in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan coated with cooking spray; lightly coat egg rolls with additional cooking spray. Bake at 425° for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown, turning once.

recipes.title: Sunflower Seed & Honey Wheat Bread
recipes.description: I've tried other bread recipes, but this one is a staple in our home. I won $50 in a bake-off with a loaf that I had stored in the freezer.

ingredients.item: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast

instructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Add bread flour, oil, honey, salt and 4 cups whole wheat flour; beat until smooth. Stir in sunflower kernels and enough remaining flour to form a firm dough.
Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, 6-8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.
Punch dough down; divide into thirds. Shape into loaves; place in 3 greased 8x4-in. loaf pans. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.
Bake at 350° until golden brown, 35-40 minutes. Brush with melted butter. Remove from pans to wire racks.

recipes.title: Wild Rice Bread with Sunflower Seeds
recipes.description: I loved skipping the boring school cafeteria meals and going to my grandma’s house for lunch. She spent most of her life in northeastern Minnesota, which is reflected in this bread's ingredients. Now my family uses this for our holiday stuffing.

ingredients.item: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast
1 package (8.8 ounces) ready-to-serve long grain and wild rice
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon unsalted sunflower kernels, divided

instructions.text: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. In a large bowl, combine rice, 1 cup sunflower kernels, milk, honey, butter, flaxseed, salt, yeast mixture, whole wheat flour and 1 cup all-purpose flour; beat on medium speed until combined. Stir in enough remaining flour to form a stiff dough (dough will be sticky).
Turn out dough onto a floured surface; knead until elastic, 6-8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1-1/4 hours.

Punch down dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface; divide in half. Roll out each half into a 12x8-in. rectangle. Roll up jelly-roll style, starting with a short side; pinch seam and ends to seal. Place each in a 9x5-in. loaf pan coated with cooking spray, seam side down.
Cover with kitchen towels; let rise in a warm place until almost doubled, about 45 minutes. Preheat oven to 375°.

Brush loaves with egg white; sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon sunflower kernels and, if desired, wheat germ. Bake 35-45 minutes or until dark golden brown. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Yogurt Cornbread
recipes.description: My husband doesn't like traditional Texas cornbread, so I came up with this recipe. This is the only kind he'll eat. Yogurt makes this variation different from most.

ingredients.item: 1 large egg, lightly beaten, room temperature

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 425°. Combine the first 5 ingredients. In another bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Pour into an 8-in. square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake until a toothpick comes out clean, 16-20 minutes.

recipes.title: Herbed Pumpkin Flatbread
recipes.description: Rosemary, thyme and pumpkin give these flatbreads an autumnal twist. They are great served with soup or salad and, of course, with curries.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons canola oil, divided
Optional: Fresh thyme, fresh rosemary and tzatziki sauce

instructions.text: In a bowl, whisk first 6 ingredients. Add pumpkin, 1 tablespoon oil and water; stir until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Turn onto a floured surface; knead 8-10 times, forming a soft dough. Cover and let rest 15 minutes.

Divide dough into 4 pieces. On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece into a 6-in. circle. Brush flatbreads on both sides with remaining 2 teaspoons oil. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook flatbreads 1-2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve warm; if desired, top with thyme and rosemary and serve with tzatziki sauce.

recipes.title: Mandel Bread
recipes.description: You don't have to know a lick of Yiddish to love mandel bread, the twice-baked Jewish treat. If you like chocolate chip biscotti, you'll love this recipe.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the oil and 1/2 cup sugar. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Then beat in the vanilla.

In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually beat into the oil mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Cover the dough, and refrigerate for at least two hours. Editor's Tip: You can chill the mandel bread dough for up to 48 hours.

Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment. Take the dough out of the refrigerator, and, on the prepared baking sheet, shape it into a 12x3-inch rectangle. Bake the shaped mandel bread until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Cool on a wire rack until firm, 10 to 12 minutes.

Transfer the baked dough to a cutting board. Using a serrated knife, cut the mandel bread crosswise into 1-inch slices. Return the slices to the parchment-lined baking sheet, placing them cut side down. Sprinkle the tops with the remaining 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake the sliced mandel bread until golden brown, four to five minutes on each side. Remove the mandel bread from the pan, and transfer to a wire rack. Allow the sliced cookies to cool completely.

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Ube Bread
recipes.description: Ube (pronounced oo-bay) is a root vegetable that's popular in Southeast Asia. You might know it as a purple sweet potato. It smells like a mix of milk candy and sweet vanilla, and it has a rich purple color.

instructions.text: For the starter, in a medium saucepan, cook water and bread flour over medium-low heat until the mixture clumps together. Remove from pan; shape into a ball. Wrap tightly; refrigerate 8 hours or overnight.

Remove starter from fridge and allow to come to room temperature. In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine all-purpose flour, milk, sugar, butter, yeast, ube extract and salt with the paddle attachment until combined. Add starter. Switch to dough hook attachment; knead on low for 30 minutes.
Turn dough onto a floured surface; shape into a ball. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 340°. Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Divide it into fourths. Roll each fourth into a ball. Working with one ball at a time, roll the dough into an 8-inch-long oval.

Fold the long edges of the oval into the middle, making long even lines on both sides. Starting from the bottom, roll the dough into a log, pinching the seam to seal and leaving spirals visible on ends. Repeat with the remaining dough balls.

Place the dough logs into a greased 9×5-inch (or 9x4x4-inch) loaf pan, seam sides down. Cover the pan with a kitchen towel and let the dough rise in a warm place until it reaches about 1/2-inch below the edge of the pan, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 340°.

Bake until the bread is deeply golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes, or until the internal temperature reads at least 190°. (Cover the pan loosely with foil during the last 10 to 15 minutes, if needed, to prevent over-browning.) Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

recipes.title: Pretzel Bread Bowls
recipes.description: These soft, chewy and irresistibly salty pretzel bread bowls are the perfect vessels for serving soup all season long.

ingredients.item: 1 large egg, room temperature, lightly beaten

instructions.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, combine the warm water, instant yeast and brown sugar. Add the flour, beer, melted butter and salt. On your mixer's lowest setting, stir the dough until it's moist, about 30 seconds. Increase the mixer to medium-low speed, and mix until the dough is smooth and pulls away cleanly from the sides of the bowl, about 8 to 10 minutes. Editor's Tip: If you're unsure whether your dough is kneaded enough, perform the windowpane test. Take a small piece of the dough and attempt to stretch it with your fingers. You should be able to stretch it thin enough to almost see through before it tears. If the dough tears immediately, the gluten has not developed enough, and you should continue kneading the dough.

Remove the dough from the bowl and shape it into a ball. Place it into a lightly oiled bowl and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Let the dough proof for one hour in a warm spot. Meanwhile, cut out four 6-inch squares of parchment paper. Set them aside.

Preheat the oven to 400°F. Divide the pretzel dough into four equal pieces and shape each into a smooth, round ball. Place each ball on a square of parchment paper and cover them with a clean towel. Let them rise for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, add 10 cups of water to a large, deep pot or Dutch oven. Bring the water to a boil, then stir in the baking soda. Editor's Tip: The pretzel dough pieces should weigh about 195 grams each.

Once the dough has finished rising, carefully lift and flip the dough balls paper side-up into the boiling water, one at a time. Boil the pretzel loaf for 30 seconds, then remove the parchment paper, flip and then boil it for an additional 30 seconds. Carefully use a slotted spoon or spider strainer to remove the boiled pretzel from the water. Let it drain, then gently place on a greased baking sheet. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Editor's Tip: Avoid moving the boiled pretzels too much once they have been placed on the baking sheet. Try to place them where you wish to bake them, as handling them at this stage can cause them to deflate, and they will not rise as nicely in the oven.

In a small bowl, beat together egg and water. Lightly brush the top of each pretzel with the egg wash and sprinkle them generously with pretzel salt. Finally, use a sharp knife or bread lame to slash a shallow "X" into the top of each pretzel bread bowl.

Bake the bread bowls for 14 to 17 minutes, or until they're deeply golden and sound hollow when tapped (the internal temperature should be 200° to 205° when measured with an instant-read thermometer). Remove the loaves promptly and transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
To serve, use a serrated knife to cut the top from each pretzel bread bowl. Hollow out the centers, leaving an edge about 1/2-inch thick. Ladle hot soup into each bowl and serve.

recipes.title: Upside-Down Apple Bread
recipes.description: The only thing more exciting than inverting our upside-down apple bread is savoring every cozy and warming cinnamon-apple bite.

instructions.text: In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and 1 tablespoon of sugar in the warm water. Let the mixture stand until it becomes proofed and frothy, about five minutes.

In a large bowl, use a hand mixer or stand mixer to beat the shortening, sugar and egg. Gradually beat in 2 cups all-purpose flour, the warmed whole milk and the yeast mixture. Add in enough of the remaining all-purpose flour to form a soft dough. Editor’s Tip: You may not need the entire flour measurement to form the dough, so add it little by little in only 1/4 or 1/3 cup measurements.

Turn out the dough onto a floured surface and knead it until smooth and elastic, six to eight minutes. Editor’s Tip: The dough is kneaded enough when you press it with a finger and the indent springs back. If the indent stays, keep kneading to work the gluten. Place the dough in a greased bowl, turning once to grease the top. Cover the dough with storage wrap or a clean kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place until doubled, about one hour. Punch the dough down with your knuckles to expel the air.

In a large bowl, toss together the apple slices, brown sugar, vanilla extract and salt. Arrange the apple slices in a single layer in a well-greased 13x9-inch baking pan, overlapping the slices slightly. Sprinkle any remaining sugar over the top.

Press the dough over the top of the apples, pressing out any large air bubbles. Cover the dough with a clean kitchen towel or storage wrap and let the dough rise until doubled in size, about 1 hour. During the last 10 minutes of rising, preheat the oven to 375°F.

Take the cover off the dough and slide the pan into the oven. Bake the upside-down apple bread until it’s golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes. Let it stand for 10 minutes, then invert the cake onto a serving platter or wire rack fitted over a baking sheet. Let the apple bread cool to room temperature.
In a small bowl, use a hand mixer or stand mixer to beat together the softened butter, confectioners’ sugar, whole milk and cinnamon until smooth. Drizzle the icing over the top of the cake.

recipes.title: One Skillet Saucy Chicken Tortilla Enchilada Rice Bake
recipes.description: Mexican seasoned chicken, rice, and enchilada sauce all cooked together in one skillet, then topped with tortilla chips and plenty of cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 pound ground chicken, beef, or turkey
1-2  jalapeños, seeded and chopped, use to your taste
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped, plus more for serving
sliced avocado and yogurt, for serving

instructions.text: 1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.2. In a large oven safe skillet, heat the olive oil over high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the ground chicken and onion. Cook, breaking up the meat as it cooks, until the chicken is browned, about 5 minutes. Add the jalapeños, garlic, paprika, cumin, and salt, cook 1 minute. Stir in the enchilada sauce, chipotle chili, if using, and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil, stir in the rice. Place the lid on the skillet and turn the heat down to the lowest setting possible. Allow the rice to cook 15 minutes, until most of the liquid has cooked into the rice, but not all of it. 3. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro and lime juice. Sprinkle 1/3 of the cheese over the chicken/rice. Add the tortilla chips on top, pressing them gently into the cheese. Evenly sprinkle on the remaining cheese. Transfer to the oven and bake 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted. 4. Serve topped as desired with avocado, cilantro, and yogurt. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Dutch Cabbage Rolls
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Combine meat, salt, pepper, rice and egg, mix well. For the sauce: saute onion in the butter until soft. Add tomato soup and equal amount of water to onion, also celery, parsley, lemon juice, sugar, salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes. Wash the cabbage leaves and boil until tender. Put equal amounts of the meat mixture into cabbage leaves, roll tightly and secure with toothpicks. Place rolls in sauce pan, pour sauce over them, cover pan and cook very slowly for 3 hours.

recipes.title: Dutch Meat Rolls
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Boova Shenkel

instructions.text: After seasoning the meat with salt and pepper, stew the meat for two hours. Then make dough with flour, baking powder, salt and the shortening. Mix into a pie-crust dough. Roll into a dozen circles 8 to 10 inches in diameter. Steam the potatoes, pared and sliced thin; add salt and pepper, 2 tablespoons of butter; the parsley and onions and then beat lightly the three eggs into the mixture. Put this mixture on the circles of dough after it has stood a little while. Fold half the circle of dough over like a half moon and press edges together tightly. Drop these into the pot with the meat and stew water. Cover tightly and cook for 30 minutes. Into a frying pan put a couple of tablespoons of fat skimmed from the stew before putting in the dough rolls, add to this 1 tablespoon of butter. In this brown small cubes of hard bread and stir in a half cup of milk. Pour this milk sauce over the Meat rolls when serving.
“Eat yourself full of what we got”

notes: Original Italian: Boova Shenkel

recipes.title: Blueberry Muffins
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar. Add fruit and egg, then milk and flour sifted with baking powder and salt. Bake in muffin tins.

recipes.title: Bran Muffins
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Sift the flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in the sugar and bran. Combine the beaten egg, milk and melted shortening. Add to the dry ingredients and mix quickly. Turn into greased muffin pans and bake in hot oven (425-f) 25 minutes. Raisins or chopped dried prunes may be added.

recipes.title: Bacon Muffins
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Sift flour, add sugar, salt and baking powder and sift again, add beaten egg and milk. Add melted shortening beating in quickly. Add bits of crisped bacon. Bake in hot (425 degree) oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with orange marmalade.

recipes.title: Walnut Gingerbread
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Cream the sugar and shortening in a bowl. Add the molasses and pour the cup of boiling water over it. Mix well. Combine the flour, soda and spices, sift and add to the molasses mixture, beating well. Add the eggs one at a time and blend thoroughly. Next add the chopped nut meats. Pour into a well greased loaf pan and bake in moderate oven (350-f) for 40 minutes.

recipes.title: Bread And Butter Pickles
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Slice cucumbers, onions and peppers. Pack in ice. Let stand 3 hours. Put a heavy weight on top the pickles. A plate with a weight on top is best. Drain well and combine with:
Mix well. Pour over pickles and simmer 30 minutes. Seal in hot jars.

recipes.title: Beaten Biscuit
recipes.source_note: Dishes & Beverages of the Old South (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Classic Southern recipe from the Old South

ingredients.item: and a half of powdered sugar
and a half of best butter
water to the pound of sugar

instructions.text: (Old Style.) Sift a quart of flour into a bowl or tray, add half a teaspoon salt, then cut small into it a teacup of very cold lard. Wet with cold water—ice water is best—into a very stiff[29] dough. Lay on a floured block, or marble slab, and give one hundred strokes with a mallet or rolling pin. Fold afresh as the dough beats thin, dredging in flour if it begins to stick. The end of beating is to distribute air well through the mass, which, expanding by the heat of baking, makes the biscuit light. The dough should be firm, but smooth and very elastic. Roll to half-inch thickness, cut out with a small round cutter, prick lightly all over the top, and bake in steady heat to a delicate brown. Too hot an oven will scorch and blister, too cold an one make the biscuit hard and clammy. Aim for the Irishman's "middle exthrame." There are sundry machines which do away with beating. It is possible also to avoid it by running the dough, after mixing, several times through a food-chopper. Also beaten biscuit can be closely imitated by making good puff paste, rolling, cutting out, pricking and baking—but rather more quickly than the real thing. All these are expedients for those who live in apartments, where the noise of beating might[30] be held against good neighborhood. Householders, and especially suburban ones, should indulge in the luxury of a block or stone or marble slab—and live happy ever after, if they can but get cooks able and willing to make proper use of it. Soda Biscuit: (Old Style.) Sift a quart of flour with a heaping teaspoonful of baking soda. Add a good pinch of salt, rub well through lard or butter the size of the fist, then wet with sour milk to a moderately soft dough, roll out, working quickly, cut with small round cutter, set in hot pans, leaving room to swell, and bake in a quick oven just below scorching heat. Handle as lightly as possible all through—this makes flaky biscuit. By way of variety, roll out thin—less than a half-inch, cut with three-inch cutter, grease lightly on top, and fold along the middle. Let rise on top a hot stove several minutes before putting to bake. By adding an egg, beaten light, with a heaping tablespoonful of sugar to the dough in mixing, these doubled biscuit will be quite unlike the usual sort.[31] Salt Rising Bread: (As Mammy Made It.) Scald a tablespoonful of sifted cornmeal, and a teaspoonful—heaped—of salt with a pint of boiling water, let stand ten minutes, then stir in, taking care to mix smooth, enough dried and sifted flour to make a thick batter. Damp flour will not rise. The batter should be almost thick enough to hold the mixing spoon upright—but not quite thick enough. Set the mixture in warm water—just as hot as you can bear your hand in. Keep up the heat steadily, but never make too hot—scalding ruins everything. Keep lightly covered, and away from draughts. Look in after an hour—if water has risen on top, stir in more flour. Watch close—in six hours the yeast should be foamy-light. Have ready three quarts of dry sifted flour, make a hole in the center of it, pour in the yeast, add a trifle more salt, a tablespoonful sugar, and half a cup of lard. Work all together to a smooth dough, rinsing out the vessel that has held the yeast, with warm not hot water to finish the mixing. Divide into loaves, put in greased pans,[32] grease lightly over the top, and set to rise, in gentle heat. When risen bake with steady quick heat. Take from pans hot, and cool between folds of clean cloth, spread upon a rack, or else turn the loaves edgewise upon a clean board, and cover with cheese cloth.
